Reviews.Title: “great place for a meeting”
Reviews.Author: mjlynch
Reviews.Content: Pros: Beautiful property, pool, scenery and landscaping large functional rooms Room service food arrive hot and was delicious meeting rooms were nice great running / biking trails and park in the area great friendly service Cons: Would have liked a few more restaurants attractions within walking distance. There is a really nice beach area about 2 miles away but we had a hard time finding more than 1-2 places to eat in the area right around the hotel and downtown is a little drive from the resort Rooms showed some minor blemishes, no deal breakers but just enough to remind you other people had stayed in the room.

Reviews.Title: “family of 4 holiday ( 2 adults and 2 small boys) - 3 rooms in 5 days!”
Reviews.Author: ACSKINS
Reviews.Content: First of all I will start with the positives. The restaurant is very good and the staff there are very friendly; The Bagel bros does great Coffee and being near mission beach etc made getting around very easy. A swimming pool is heated and very nice. Now for the downside - the rooms. I have stayed in a wide variety of Hyatt / Omnis and Hiltons around the world so I am used to some ' intresting' situations when it comes to hotel but this has to go down as the worst experience with rooms I have had for a very long time. Received upgrade due to status - opened the curtains, looked out of the balcony to gaze upon the wonderful view of the garbage bins and AC system off the balcony. So requested the rooms which I had originally booked in the suites, walked through the doors and stepped back into the 80s. Opened the curtains to be face to face with a couple staring over the hedge into our room ( not the water / ocean view I was expecting). Sofa was broken and 1 of the queen beds was broken, generally dirty with a strange smell and humming noise ( I was now next to the garbage bins and the A/C unit). Moved again into the tower, higher floor but still lookiing over the garbage and the incesent noise of the a/c system rumbling most of the day and night. bath switch broke so trying to shower a 2 year old for 3 days was challenging. Reported the issue to reception who kept promising maintenance would repair but to no avail. Then no hot water unless we ran the shower for a full 10mins every morning. I could go on but I think you get the picture - to summarise: lovely hotel, great location, restaurant staff and consiege very helpful but rooms and noise need sorting. Main advice, beware of the suits unless you fancy a trip back to the 80s and bring cleaning items with you.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was great but property is not a four star”
Reviews.Author: busielady1
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate of $95 through priceline and the location was very central to all the attractions we wanted to see. We were thrilled since this property frequently rents for over $200. However, we learned that there is an additional parking charge of $20 per night. I have paid additional parking fees in large cities downtown but I can't see how this property gets away with it since they are not downtown, and they have a huge parking lot for guests. This always seems a bit dishonest to me because people reserving rooms on the major internet sites think they are getting one price when in fact, the price is $20 higher per night. The right thing to do is just raise your room rates $20 and don't charge for parking. We were placed in a two story building with a small room that was very musty smelling. I could not take it. So I went to the front desk and spoke to Jeff who did change my room to the tower. The difference in the rooms from the two story to the tower is significant. We went from a small smelly room to a much larger room with a air purifier in the room and a balcony with a great view of the harbor. They did not have a room with two beds available so Jeff sent up a complimentary rollaway bed. Jeff is a great asset to this property and if it were not for him, I would have rated the hotel very low. He salvaged our stay. Both rooms had off white walls, white comforters, and were very bland and should be updated. However, two good things were the comfort of the bed and the great shower head that really delivered a powerful stream of hot water! I probably would not stay here again though. I would try a different property in La Jolla or del Mar area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel... but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: lanita5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to have a getaway for the weekend he picked up this hotel, which is really nice , amenities are o.k comfy bed, pillows, nice staff, heated pool and nice environment... BUT it is very noisy we could hear from our 8th floor room the sea lions "singing" the whole night.... also they charge 20 dlls for self parking which i thing is too much, its hard to find a spot to park....for what we paid they should have free WiFi........ what I found outrageous is that they charge 3 dlls per every small single bottle of water. as I said it before it is a nice hotel... has a great view and location.... the bagel place which is right at the marina it is a must...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the Hyatt Regency Mission Bay”
Reviews.Author: youngcjpl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed four nights in mid March. We booked through Price Line so we got a fairly good price. Positives: the hotel is in a good location, not downtown, but not that far to drive to the sights around San Diego. A car is a must if you are staying here. We enjoyed Mission Beach which was close by and also enjoyed a couple of restaurants. The Mission was excellent for breakfast - ample portions of good food and prompt and friendly service. We also enjoyed Bella La Italia for dinner. Good food and very friendly service. There was also a Starbucks and a grocery store close by. Anyway, back to the review of the hotel.... Room was nice, but nothing outstanding. We were in the tower and had a nice view of the marina - which supposedly was an "upgrade". The room was large, bed only somewhat comfortable as the mattress pad/cover was lumpy and shifted easily. Weird bathroom. No bath tub, only a stand up shower! Additional costs were $20 a day for parking and $15 a day for high speed internet. We knew about these costs ahead of time, and since we had a good deal with Price Line it didn't really bother us. We did NOT use the hotel internet, we went to Starbuck's instead where it is free. It seems to me that the parking and internet fees should now adays be included in the nightly rate! The room and hallways were clean. The hotel concierge has discounted tickets for local attractions including the zoo. The room initially didn't have any facecloths and only minimal hangers. These were added upon request. The weather was very cool while we were in San Diego, so we didn't use the pool and only used the hot tub once. The pool has slides which the children seem to be enjoying. The hot tub was nice, but not that big.

Reviews.Title: “Little Issues Add Up To Unpleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: JakeAdams72
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at this hotel on business and experienced a series of incidents that left me wondering if a two tier guest system is in place here. My room was in a two story building and after specifically requesting a quiet room was promptly put overlooking the pool music system and a busy walkway. My room was musty and far from the spa-treatment hypoallergenic promos seen at check in. I wanted to shave and close the drain in the sink; the handle flew off. My iHome clock radio was broken. Meanwhile this is far from a suitable business hotel -- no free WiFi and a "business center" of three wireless PCs with nonfunctional printers. If not for Samantha at the concierge desk I would have gone ballistic as she managed my extreme inconvenience well. Still, an important fax document sent by the front desk at 11pm so it could be received the next morning never got to its destination despite the front desk's assurances. Lastly I took a look at my colleague's room in The Tower and it was beautiful! Ocean view, clean and quiet ... and supposedly a preferred room even though we booked the rooms exactly the same way and at the same rate. The staff was extremely attentive and corrected all of the problems swiftly. Samantha took $50 off my hotel bill. Still I will likely not return to this property unless with small kids and tickets to Sea World. For business this was a near Epic Fail and very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly poor”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: Just completed a family vacation where the last 3 nights were spent in San Diego. I had stayed at the Hyatt Mission Bay many years ago and liked its proximity to Seaworld which is why I chose it again. Here are my gripes: 1. Room check out is 11 a.m. so when arriving at 4 p.m. to check in, and then told that you have to wait an hour because the rooms were not available is very frustrating (turns out only one housekeeper on the floor which is why 6 hours later not all the rooms were ready). 2. NO communication as to why the rooms were not ready and I had to keep checking back with the desk, despite giving them my cell phone number to eventually get checked in. 3. Was promised when booking that two adjacent rooms on the ocean side in the Regency Club level would be secured. Upon arriving they had "no record" of this request, wanted to give me two rooms that were not adjacent (which I refused since I have kids) and I had to eventually take the two rooms they did have available on the non-view side. 4. Rental car was damaged by their so called Valet car parkers, which is ACE by the way, who of course refuse to accept any liability for their damage and now I will need to fight with Hertz and Allstate. The manager from Ace investigating the claim was nice enough, but it was clear from the outset that they had no intention of doing the right thing and accepting responsibility for their negligence. All in all, it seems that this property is run by very young managers and staff that really don't know how to take care of people but are very focused on their computers and each other.

Reviews.Title: “Very unclean rooms for the nice surroundings!”
Reviews.Author: LMBdavis1
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks like it has it all. I was so disappointed with the cleanliness of our room. Upon checking in we thought we had entered someone eldest room. Left over old wineglasses and a used towel on the sink. I called the front desk and they told us they would have someone come by as we were going out. When we came back nothing was done. I called the front desk again a little more upset since we had been out for a few hours. They sent someone over as we waited outside on our patio....after the person left they still did not fully clean up. The next morning we found black hairs in our towels and we gave up....would not stay here again....our next hotel s Holiday Inn wad much better!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good view of the Marina and FUN for kids!”
Reviews.Author: plasticnurse
Reviews.Content: First of all, we stayed at this hotel on a smoking deal from Priceline.com. We only paid $99 per night when the nightly rate was $239 normally. We had a room overlooking the pool in the tower which the kids really enjoyed. The room was very clean, modern and comfy. The beds were very comfy and there was also a refrigerator in our room, this came in handy for all of the bottled water we brought along on our travels since we drove from AZ. The pool was heated but the first night we arrived you couldn't tell. I think they forgot to turn the heater on and the jacuzzi was tepid so we didn't get to enjoy that much. On the bright side, I complained the next day and within 30 minutes, the jacuzzi was well over 100 degrees and the pool was nearing 78 degrees! They have three water slides, one for the smaller kids and two for more adventurous kids! We ate at the poolside restaurant called "Swim" which was not good at all. I was surprised that the food was as bad as it was for the caliber of hotel you are staying at. Needless to say, lots of room for improvement there. We stayed 3 nights and on the last night there we ordered a pizza from one of the local pizza joints, I believe it was pizza bella? Great pizza and salad. Would totally stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JeffAPhoenix
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel last week for one night as we went to Sea World. Very close to Sea World which is nice. Check in was very busy and had a long line but quick once I was seen. I had called in advance asking for a crib in the room and they had forgot to do that. I requested it again and then it was taken care of immediately. Pools had some trash floating in one of them but may have been due to the wind. Staff were all very nice and the room was basic. The outdoor patio is one long patio which connects to all the rooms which was a little weird and didn't like how when our neighbors were smoking it would blow into our room so we never could open our door for fresh air as they would walk up and down and smoke. You also have to have your blinds closed at all times since someone can just walk up and look into your room which we didn't like. We didn't eat at any of the places on site as they were expensive. Also wished they had a shuttle that would've taken us to Sea World as previous hotels we've stayed at did. They apparently only have it operating during the summertime. All in all, a decent place and no real major concerns but not sure we'll make this a frequent stop for use when in town.

Reviews.Title: “Feedback on my stay at the Hyatt Regency Mission Bay, San Diego, CA 92109”
Reviews.Author: Tia N
Reviews.Content: To the potential Hyatt Regency Mission Bay, San Diego customers. I come from New Zealand which is a very small country down under (East of Australia and North of Antarctica). My stay at this hotel far exceeded my expectations. We stayed in the Tower Block which showcased spectacular panoramic views of this pretty city. The room was clean and the house-keeping staff were by far very respectful and did a splendid job. The fridge could've been more functional as I would've loved to have put left overs or a bottle of water in the fridge. Nonetheless this matter was superceded by the beautiful conference food and refreshments served at the conference. The staff's personable ability to assist was exemplary and a big ups to Brian at the Red Marlin. Your comical and witty personality at breakfast was a lovely way to start the day at the on site conference. I look forward to coming back to the Hyatt Regency to attend the same conference in 2014. Many thanks Tia.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the sea lions!”
Reviews.Author: Alisha A
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights..... Four sleepless nights... We stayed in 'The Suites' building that runs along the length of the marina and there were sea lions barking all night long every night that we were there. We tried to get a fan from the front desk to help drown out the noise but apparently fans are a hot commodity and there were none available. The bed was lumpy and very soft. The hotel doesn't use fitted sheets, so if you move around too much, the sheets start to shift and cause rolls of lumps that are not very comfortable to sleep on. The pillows leave something to be desired as well.... They smoosh down as soon as you lay on them and provide zero support. Another thing was this stench near the bed. It smelled of urine. I couldn't quite pin down where the smell was coming from, but it seemed to be coming from the carpet and/or the bastketweave fabric-like headboard. We actually went to Target to purchase Febreeze to help cover the stench. As far as the room itself, it is decent. It's a good size but with mildly ugly decor and a nice patio overlooking the marina. The fridge is a pile of crap. There is a warning sign on the fridge that says "Refridgerator can not safely store medical or dairy products", so if you're a milk drinker or need to store your insulin, you're out of luck. The fridge is very small, not even large enough to store a couple beers and a leftovers container. I did not try any of the restaurants on site so I can not comment on that. The pool area is nice and the bar by the pool serves a decent cocktail. I'll finish with something positive.... The hotel staff are friendly and courteous and the cleaning crew does a good job of remaking the bed and filling the towels and such. The hotel is in a good area with very easy access to highways and to downtown. The view of the marina truly is beautiful and is very nice to look out upon in the morning. As far as my ratings go, I'm giving cleanliness a 2 only because of the awful smell. Otherwise, the cleanliness is average of Hyatt - clean towels and linens.

Reviews.Title: “we visit when doing a 'stay-cation'”
Reviews.Author: wanacarlsbad
Reviews.Content: We love the location. Plenty of nearby restaurants and easy access to downtown activities. The staff is very helpful and always seems to have a pleasant attitude. Rooms are upgraded, modern and up to top standards. The valet desk is extra helpful with current information and inside tips. They perform an invaluable service, especially to those visitors from outside the SD area. We'll continue to partake of the Hyatt's services.

Reviews.Title: “The best location..period”
Reviews.Author: iluvorlando
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to this property for over 18 years now and seen many changes thru the years. The recent renovation has been an improvement as the grounds are just beautiful. This property takes such great care to maintain the beauty of the landscaping. The pools are more suited to the little ones as they are all very shallow so if you have young kids it's perfect. They have 1 jacuzzi and 3 pools all clean and well kept.....the poolside drinks are really good too! try a mojito made by Jeff...he is the best! We love the tower rooms as the view is incomparable to any other, however I was a little surprised of the condition of a few minor things. Our bathroom sink had a huge crack in it and seemed to leak thru a bit, how does one crack a sink that new and heavy. We stayed on the 17th floor and the room was large and clean. Nice light ocean colors along with a great sitting area makes it a very pleasant atmosphere. Our room was facing the ocean and what a spectacular view! We also had access to the regency Club, which had been renovated since we had last visited. It looked clean, comfortable and well thought out except I was unimpressed with the selection of evening bites and choices as there used to be many more options now it's just vege's, cheese, crackers and 1 dessert selection. They still have an honor bar which is nice and offer nice beverage selections. In my opinion, for the extra money to have access to this level, they could offer some hot items or even maybe a light protein or pasta? The morning fare was nice and offered cold items along with pastries, cereal, bagels, fruit, juices and yogurt. I was really disappointed with room service. This is one area I think this location suffers badly. There are 2 options of on-site restaurants and no in-between except for an Einstein bagel shop. It could be hit and miss , but with a Hyatt brand I think the food at this site could use a big improvement and must be looked at seriously by the hotel especially for the price. There is a really good casual fish market right down the boardwalk that rocks! and the fish is all locally caught...a must! I didn't try the buffet breakfast at Red Marlin, although I heard people saying it was very over-priced and not worth it. I would also suggest going to the Hyatt Manchester at Seaport village where they have a seafood restaurant called Sally's, it is right on the marina and the sushi is incredible! The concierge service is pretty non-existant at this property now, so it seems which is unfortunate. I noticed the lack of assistance in that department over the weekend and it was sad to see that such a needed position was not be executed properly. The concierge I asked 1 question to seriously told me "I don't know" and never even bothered to find an answer...wow. Pro's: Lovely rooms in the tower and Marina Suites, nice bathroom amenities, comfy bed, decor was nice and clean, beautiful grounds and views..location..location..location Con's: lack of concierge, front desk knowledge and help, minimal restaurant choices, expensive room service compared to quality of food

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Resort”
Reviews.Author: acgardiner
Reviews.Content: Fabulous 180 degree views provided you're on the west side of the tower. Be sure to ask for the tower. I was put into a cabana at first which was dark and musty smelling. I went back to the front desk and asked if I could be moved and they put me onto an executive floor (16th) facing the Pacific Ocean! Not much around here in the way of shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel N
Reviews.Content: Amazing location, fantastic staff and exceptional rooms & view. I usually come here for friends birthdays, and it's always a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to relax on Mission Bay, would definitely stay again...”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorMS
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay on Mission Bay to relax, and the Hyatt Regency Mission Bay was the perfect place to do just that. It's just far enough away for it to be relaxing and semi-secluded, yet close enough to not be more than minutes away to eveything you'd want to do in San Diego(Gaslamp, Sea World, Zoo, Old Town, Mission/Pacific Beach). I can see why this place can tend to get crowded during the in-season months, though wouldn't mind staying here either way. From the room to the grounds and the staff it was everything I could expect in a Hyatt, they are the gold standard of hotel chains in my experience. The three pools and the hot tub were all very nice, as well as the hotel bar, the outdoor firepits and the grounds were fun to walk around, extending into the Mission Bay area, marinas, etc. The on-site restaurant, Red Marlin was very good and priced around what you would expect for a hotel-resort restuarant. The hotel and Regency Club staff were more thajn great, taking time to help us when needed and always ready to lend assistance. (the waiter at the restaurant actaully phoned our room to tell us my wife had left her credit card there and when I explained she was already on her way back to get it he ran out and met her halfway in the rain!) We also visited the Blue Marble spa while there and while it's not as big as most spas I have been in it was a very relaxing experience as well. Other than being crowded during peaks because it is such a nice place I can't see how anyone could complain about this hotel. Will most definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Lodge on the Desert”
Reviews.Author: billwish Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everyone was very pleasant and accomodating. Property was wll maintained. Common areas, pool, lobby, reading/computer/game room were very nice. The restaurant and bar also were nice. The outdoor fireplace was a nice place to visit with friends. Look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best.”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravler07675
Reviews.Content: Rooms are pretty poor find a better hotel for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: bwisetraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in January. Friendly staff. Sea world is across the way. Food in resturaunt was good and dining near the pool area. Only have good thoughts regarding this hotel. Would certainly stay again..A short walk from the hotel along the marina is a geat fish and chip shop. ( Fries ) they sell a range of food again friendly staff and good food.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: cfnm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. Room was very nice with great views. Heard and then saw seals from our balcony. Pool area very nice. Parking garage is a bit inconvenient to get to. For being an older property, it is in very nice condition. The flight pattern for the airport goes right over this property. Property is very nice. Great pool area, very lush and tropical. Red Marlin Restaurant served great food. Staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Family Fun!”
Reviews.Author: aayo
Reviews.Content: My family and I came here last summer and had an amazing time. There staff are great and gave you lots of advice on where to do. We went to the San Diego zoo and the nearby boardwalk with rides and games. The pools and slides are so much fun and strolling along the docks looking at boats is so relaxing, There are so many seals and you can here them from the resort! Beautiful grounds and great food. We also rented a boat there and drove along the bay. Again, we saw many of seals. Some were even swimming beside us! I recommend this to any family that wants to go to a relaxing place friendly to kids!

Reviews.Title: “View? Excellent. Room? So-So Quiet? Now Way!”
Reviews.Author: Sun-Sand-Surf-Beer
Reviews.Content: FroggySmith from PA was spot on with his comments about conference noise. My wife and I stayed during the same time period. One conference included a noisy shout ridden "team building" event that made us want to shout back and another evening dinner/dance event had a "do it yourself" camera system set outside for couples. FLASH FLASH FLASH I'll also add the fact that the hotel is adjacent to a bridge leading to the beach so traffic noise was common if you like your balcony door open as we do. Flight noise is relentless daily but that may be common to San Diego. We paid for a view of the bay, which was excellent. I travel for business from time to time and the room itself was below average for the price. The grounds and lobby were pretty though. Parking? $20 a day adds up. If you're there during a conference, such as we were, be prepared to look for parking like you're at a mall during Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great food, but don't ask for a quiet room!”
Reviews.Author: FroggySmith
Reviews.Content: Ok, I will admit that I am staying at this hotel on a conference room rate, which is more than reasonable. When I made reservations specifically requested a quiet room and even called to confirm. Yes, they had the information I was told. What a joke. This is a conference hotel for sure, great setting. As I write this the speaker outside my door is blaring. (During the day it was relatively low.) There is a party going on in the cabana area steps from my door complete with mic and video. Yes, the staff is great, restaurant exceptional, but when you have to turn room fan on high to block noise something is wrong. Too bad. A very nice respite turned into a hunker down experience. Wish the staff had given me an option. Would have gladly paid more for quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great views, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Emanville
Reviews.Content: We got a deal on this hotel through Priceline. The hotel, views, and location are great. The staff was extremely helpful. Jeff helped us with our check-in and check-out. He went out of his way to help us get into a great room when we checked in. We were able to upgrade to an awesome room in the tower (one of the top floors with a full ocean/bay view) for a nominal cost. It was well worth it. I look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Family trip”
Reviews.Author: xannet13
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience here. I called and made reservations and they offered us a beach front view 15th floor. My husband and I planned this family trip together for our 4yr old and our 5 month old. We also had our chiuahuuah with us. We were well treated and had a lovely stay. We went to sea world we left our dog in the room. We will definetly be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “The old outside look doesn't reflect the modern inside”
Reviews.Author: Mason2012
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for business. The hotel is a short 15-min drive from the airport. You cannot miss the fact that it looks old from the outside. The suites part of the hotel, which is separate from the main tower looks really very old and may give a false impression. From the inside, the property is really modern. As with all water properties, you cannot avoid some mildew. One part of the hotel (apart from the suites) is located totally outside the building. In fact you need to leave the reception back to the main entrance and that's quite odd why they keep that part. They don't have buffet breakfast, it's a la carte menu

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marsha H
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughter for a few days for her 12th bday. I got a great price doing the Priceline "name your own price" thing. I was a litle worried because I read some bad reviews but I could not be refunded if I switched hotels. I am so glad that we stayed here. It was a wonderful place. We did not encounter one unpleasant employee during the whole stay. Everyone was exceptionally nice and helpful. We were upgraded for $50 a night to a corner suite on the 14th floor. The views of the ocean and marina were beautiful! We are from the mid west and it was awesome to see the sunrise and sunset over the ocean everyday. The pool was great even for Jan. and I loved the hot tub. We had lunch at "Swim" it was pretty good. We did dinner at Red Marlin. The food and service was terrific and they even gave my daughter a free dessert for her bday. We took a cab to Sea World for $7. We walked 5 minutes away to the San Diego Whale Watch. I highly recommend that as well. It was magical seeing the whales and dolphins. Room service breakfast was a little cold but that is the only negative thing I can say. My daughter is already talking about going back for her 13th. We will definately stay here again if we come back to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “A great Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: jward1
Reviews.Content: An excellent family stay great location within walking distance of Sea World. The waterfront rooms have directly overlook the marina which is great. The kids loved the waterslides in the pool and didny want to leave. The only downside was the sun did start to leave the pool area just after 3pm, however we did go in Jan when the days are short anyway. The suite was nice and spacious and the beds were comfortable. The food around the pool and in the red marlin was excellant and the kids loved the bagel shop. You do pay extra to park the car which I think is the only real downside of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay...with exceptions”
Reviews.Author: azwytravelers
Reviews.Content: We arrived and were pleasantly surprised with the front desk staff. We asked for an upgrade and we were able to negotiate one...a suite overlooking the bay. What a great way to awake...viewing the harbor. Now the cons.....parking....the cab fares in San Diego are high. Renting a car is a good idea, but there is no parking on the street and you're forced to park in the hotel parking..$20.00 a night....a scam used by all properties at mission bay. The restaurants on property were good. be sure to visit the mom & pop fish shack down the bay...a nice restaurant with good food. Overall an older property that is trying and staff that is very helpful. You'll pay for EVERYTHING internet, faxing etc. Pools and rooms are clean and close to seaworld..not sure if it's worth the price they're asking.

Reviews.Title: “Kid friendly and classy by SEAWORLD”
Reviews.Author: Scubashark0822
Reviews.Content: Views from room are the best in San Diego. You get the bay and ocean. Three pools and hot tub. Two bigger slides and one kid slide make for a fun time. One pool has a sloped beach like entry which is safer for smaller kids. $25 daily for valet and $20 for regular parking but lot is so close that regular is fine. Just be careful as the spots are tiny. You can roast marshmallows on the fire pits and during the summer they have a shuttle to Seaworld. Note: summer only. One qualm was the $10 daily Internet fee which wouldn't have been bad if it wasn't per device which I wasn't aware about until $40 later at check out when logged in from laptop, kindle, and phone. Service was amazing and staff went above and beyond. I would come back here everytime I go to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Mission Bay”
Reviews.Author: Ashley K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel several times. From the minute you arrive the staff is very helpfull in helping with all of your needs. The location is amazing. It is close to mission beach and you can walk down the boardwalk to different restaurants and shopping. The view alone is amazing! We like to get a higher view and enjoy the view from the balcony. The ocean view is the side we like to stay on. The Red Marlin is a decent restaurant but a bit spendy. I would recommend this hotel to anyone because of the great experiences we have had while staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Charles D
Reviews.Content: Let's get the easy stuff out of the way-the hotel was clean, modern and appears to have been recently renovated. Great for vacation but not for business travelers. It was a $30 cab ride to the convention center (I thought it was much closer and they will tell you on the phone that it's a short cab ride). I checked in at night and the reception is not the hotel. You haveto go back outside to get to your room even for the tower. It's not well light and the signs were confusing. It's like your wandering around Jurasic Park. I finaly found the entrance to the tower. Now to find the bar...one of then is in the restuarant Red Marlin..a short hike through the jungle. My friend isnt there..he's in the pool bar..which also doesnt have an inside entrance. Back through the jungle. You can see the bar but you cant get to it. Now a locked gate (have to use your room key). Now the bar, but where's the door in all this glass. OK..now setttled. No soft drink machines on the floors, no coffee in the lobby. Breakfast is back at the Red Marlin..what??? OK..there's a Enstein Bagel shop..how do I get there? back through Jurasic Park..down the path..through the parking lot, Turn right up the path to the walkway.. Walk down 100 yards to the store. Get it?? I checked out heading for the Bayfront Hilton...everything's in one building..including the coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views, great property, wanna go back and stay longer”
Reviews.Author: Michelle B
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one weeknight recently. A friend from out of town got a great deal from hotwire so we stayed. The property was amazing, the views spectacular. The pools were pretty warm and the pool area was large and welcoming, with multiple pools and waterslides. There is a pool bar that has large fire pits. We had trouble with the plumbing, but they came and fixed it immediately and offered us breakfast. The rooms had plenty of space and had a great balcony with comfy chairs. Both the adults thought the beds were very hard. The restaurant is right over the marina and had really good (but expensive) food.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT waste your Money! Listen to the reviews!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Edeli823
Reviews.Content: I'm currently in this hotel and Thank God it's just 1 night! I got this hotel from Priceline for $115 and I would of rather payed $300 at another property! First of all our room looks like a motel! Within 2 hours we have been in 2 different rooms! The first room had spiders which I will post the pictures shortly and the second room was filthy!!! The carpet was very stained, dust everywhere and the heater did not even work! We went to the front desk and the rude clerk was wondering while we're complaining again and we are still waiting for a phone call. This ruined our vacation we are stuck in this room trying to fix maintainence issues. I work in Vegas in the hotel industry and we would never treat our guests like this. Don't waste your money, time and vacation on this nightmare hotel. Please see photos.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Vis78759
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff greets you as you walk into the beautiful lobby of this Mission Bay Hyatt. As a platinum member, I usually get good treatment at the Hyatts I visit. This visit was exceptional. Our room was large, spacious and came with a private balcony with a view of the bay and pacific ocean. 8th floor gave a great vantage point and the grounds of the property. Absolutely amazing. OK so the PROS: Radio was on when we entered room with some nice mood music (nice touch). Rooms are spacious and clean. Modern design. Comfortable bed. Concierge called to ensure we were happy. CONS: $20 per night self parking with no street parking option within walking distance. TV picture quality poor for such a nice hotel. Towels were old, thin and worn, I really was not impressed with the towels, again, given the caliber of the hotel I expected better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean but gotta pay for extras”
Reviews.Author: leex1080
Reviews.Content: We were just at the Hyatt and we got a good deal via Priceline name your own price. The grounds and room was very clean. Easy distances to the Bay, Sea World, and everything you need to see in the area. We got a ground floor hotel not part of the tower. I loved it as we got an outdoor space with a firepit. My only complaint was that you have to pay $20/day for parking (ouch!) and for internet. I guess I am use to having free internet so that was a big bummer.

Reviews.Title: “nicely upgraded and tropical”
Reviews.Author: PCT1212
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel in San Diego. Nice location near Mission Beach and SeaWorld. Recently upgraded lobby, rooms, pool and restaurant. Very nice views from the Tower rooms and the Red Marlin restaurant is great. Nice outdoor bar with fire pits as well.

Reviews.Title: “Clean with Great views.”
Reviews.Author: hrumph
Reviews.Content: Booked this through Priceline's name your own price Glad this was chosen for me. With really no plans,our family of 4 needed a place to sleep. We arrived and the staff member immediately offered an upgrade to higher ocean view floor at a very fair price over what I paid. Not pushy at all. John and rest of staff that night were very pleasant. Talked football Beautiful manicured grounds with pools and palm trees. Concierge helped with ideas and Zoo tickets with perfect directions. Rooms are very clean and spacious. Great shower.may sound silly,but with two teenage boys...that means something. Well done Hyatt. Hope others feel same way

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Quiet and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: LauraSmigi
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an Waterfront Suite K - definitely worth the extra $$ for this room. It was very spacious and had a fabulous view of the marina. It was relatively quiet, clean and comfortable. It is located near Sea World, so I was concerned that it might be noisy with families and was pleasantly surprised to find it was not. The location is close to downtown, La Jolla, the malls and sporting venues. We stayed here several years ago and it needed a remodel then. I'm pleased to say that it has been remodeled and the rooms have all the latest amenities: high speed internet, flat screen TV, refrigerator and desk with lots of outlets.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a so so hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Travelinggirl104
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel at 5PM. The room wasn't ready. The room wasn't going to be ready for a few hours. The hotel lobby was very crowded and there was a long line. The rooms were adequate but nothing special. The property is large. The location is great. We ate breakfast at the Red Marlin a few mornings. The staff was great! The food was very good. Our waiter sent me on my way each morning with a cup of coffee in a to go cup. They gave good suggestions for activities. We went fishing and rented jet skies. We were able to arrange all of our activites via a very short walk to the pier. Parking at the hotel is free. It is a family destination. If you are looking for a romantic get away pick another hotel in San Diego. The pool area is mobbed with kids and families all day. However, you can get a cocktail and relax while watching the action. They didn't seem to have enough help. My room didn't get cleaned until late afternoon. One day, I told our maid to forget it because it was almost dinner time. The poor girl looked beat and she kept apologizing. Concierge recommended a restaurant - World Famous. She arranged VIP seating so we didn't have to wait very long and complimentary valet at the restaurant. Loved it! The food was great and the atmosphere was wonderful. We also went to a Padres game and to the mall. There is a lot to do in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as the first time”
Reviews.Author: cyberdudeAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a second time as after our first stay which we loved, we wanted to return and stay here again. It certainly was not bad just had really high expectations but it didnt deliver this time. We were here for our 10 year anniversary and stayed in a waterfront suite. The room we got was right out the front of the deli / kiosk so that is what we looked at when looking out the window or on the balcony. I did book this time through expedia and got a great rate so probably why we got this room. Also noticed that our room was missing a sofa in the lounge area that all other rooms had. Not really important I know but just detracted from what we had had before. We also had just come from staying at Hyatt in palm springs and the difference in fees was interesting. Internet access, water etc were included in resort fee and parking was less and undercover. Here you had to pay extra for internet and bottled water was quite a few $$ and parking was out in the open and I dont even know if it was secure. I dont really understand why the Hyatts have different fees. Thought it would be standard. The hotel itself is beautifull with great facilities so don't get me wrong as it is still a lovely place but seeing that we mentioned it was our anniversary and got a room with no view and the fees that are charged, next time we will stay somehwere else. Staff were lovely but this time round it wasn't as good as our first stay

Reviews.Title: “Superb room, superb view”
Reviews.Author: Darren B
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! I had a corner room that had over 180 degree views of the ocean, boat marina and San Diego city in the distance. The room was very spacious with separated sleeping area with TV and a lounge room with large work desk and another TV, opening out onto a large balcony. The grounds are very well maintained and have a very nice tropical feel. There is a large pool, with an excellent bar and restaurants close by. The staff were very friendly and helpful with tips on things to do and restaurants nearby. If you want to eat off site, restaurants are a short drive/cab ride away. They also offer a choice of valet parking or free self parking - I chose the latter which was right outside the building I was staying in. I highly recommend this hotel, especially for families.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Room and Amazing View”
Reviews.Author: geezersgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency while visiting friends in San Diego. I grew up in this area and wanted a hotel on the water. I found a 48 hr sale on the Hyatt website and I managed to get a corner suite in the tower for $118 per night. After reading some less than flattering reviews I was not sure what to expect. I was so happy that nothing I had read turned out to be true for us. The room was immaculate and just gorgeous. We were on the 7th floor overlooking the pool and Mission Bay. We did not use the pool but did sit in the hot tub several times. The hot tub was clean and nice and hot. There is also a poolside bar with an outdoor fire pit that is nice in the evenings. We did not use room service but did have dinner one night at the Red Marlin. The food is wonderful if not slightly overpriced. We did like that Einsteins Bagels is a short walk right out the gate. Parking is expensive but I always use valet if available and just factor in the extra cost when looking for a room. My husband loved the gift shop as they had some really nice Tommy Bahama shirts for less than half price of what you would pay elsewhere. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff...ugly fees”
Reviews.Author: aztrtl
Reviews.Content: Location is wonderful. Close to Sea World, Mission Beach, Belmont Park, shopping and more. $20 a day to park ($25 for valet) in a parking lot that is so small even a smart car couldn't park correctly. Large truck or SUV or returning late to hotel, forget about parking. $13.95 a night for internet (we chose to not use). Holiday Inn has free parking, free internet and free breakfast. We got our rate through 3rd party site so decided to stay. There was a blood stain on our toilet seat, but housekeeping immediately came to disinfect and offer apologies. For the location, this was perfect for my boyfriend, myself and his 2 boys. The fees were high and we did not eat on site. The boys however enjoyed the pool and the slides.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, Stylish rooms, Attentive, Friendly staff, Regular price too high”
Reviews.Author: OccaisionalTravel
Reviews.Content: I got a super priceline rate on this room. Obviously it wasn't in the tower with a view, but it was very stylish and comfortable. The grounds are spectacular and right on the marina. I'm sure the restaurant was great although I was too cheap to dine there. The fitness center is surprizingly well equipped with a great view of the marina (you will need help finding it though). This is where my frugality comes in. I always thought that the higher the price, the fewer extra charges there would be. I couldn't understand the $35 valet or $25/night self park when the hotel seemed to own their own lots. It was a nice location, but I don't think it was in an area where parking is usually not free. Maybe since they were so close to Sea World they figured they could pull it off since Sea World charges for parking. I could understand the internet not being included in my room since I got it at less than half price. Best Western, MicroTel, Holiday Inn and almost every place I've ever stayed offer it for free BTW. The breakfast wasn't free either. I still got a great deal for the level of property it was but I might not have been as happy if I paid full price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel for business or family”
Reviews.Author: dreytuch
Reviews.Content: I have the chance to stay here, but sadly just for one night. I want to come back with the family. It is a lovely hotel on the Bay. I had a view of the roller coaster at Sea World from across the Bay. Great fitness center looking out on the water, and the breakfast menu is just fantastic, and was as tasty as it sounded. Great little kid slides at the very family friendly pool. Only downside for me was that as a Platinum Hyatt member they "upgraded" me to a tower room, but the room was on the elevator shaft. Sounded like trucks going through my room all night. They credited me the next morning, but it was a long night and I should have changed rooms, but the tower was away from the main hotel, so too much of a hassle. I could hear the sea lions from my balcony--they were barking up a storm, and it was quite amusing. Parking is not included, and is quite expensive--seems like it should be, as it is just an open self park lot.

Reviews.Title: “nice relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: mich54321
Reviews.Content: Was going to cancel my booking after bad reviews on here, but spoke to front desk and they upgraded me to a Tower Room. There is nothing wrong with this hotel - the pool area is really nice. Hotel is located in Mission Bay area with nice walks around the marina and Pacific Beach nearby. Loved the firepit and s'mores - great to warm up with at night. Contacted maintenance and housekeeping and both quick to respond. Would stay again. Only downside is $20 self parking - but this seems standard for American hotels but would be nice if this was free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service / Very Nice Facility”
Reviews.Author: kjclark1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I purchased the room from priceline.com, name your own price. We got an unbelievable price for a room on New Years Eve. Upon arrival, Jon at the front desk gave us a great room on the 7th floor overlooking the marina. He was very professional and explained the facility in detail. We eat at the Swim Bar and the food was very good. The jacuzzi was large enough for about 15 people, and was positioned with views of the pool and tower. Very Nice. The best was the customer service given by Manager Michael, the night manager. Unfortunately, we had a someone in the room next to us with a crying baby. We are not ones to complain about much, but finally we call down to the front desk. Understanding Michael or the Hyatt could not do anything about the crying baby, Michael let my wife vent and offered a few freebees. We asked for Michael to add comments to our account should we want to take advantage of the offers. Later in the morning we did take advantage of the offers and had to speak with the day manager, Robert. He was equally as nice and could see what Michael had written on the account. I can say that Michael and Robert went far beyond the original offer for compensation, and we were well cared for. Front staff Ruth finished the checking out process, and was continued the great service. Even if the mishap hadn't occurred, my wife and I would still recommend this hotel. Its just good to know the staff and customer service etiquette would be there should you need it. Thank Hyatt and the staff for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing vacation, excellent property and service”
Reviews.Author: tillie28
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at this hotel the week after Christmas, each time has exceeded our expectations. Both times we have reserved the tower southwest high floor corner suite (aka VIP Suite)which has beautiful ocean, pool and marina views. The location is on Mission Bay close to sandy beaches, La Jolla, Old Town, Sea World and many other San Diego attractions. Excellent service, attention to detail and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: Mom_with_Teenagers14
Reviews.Content: Got a screaming deal on another web site, so that made the deal worthwhile, even with the $25/day valet parking charge. Travis upgraded us even though we were "on the cheap" guests. Customer service was amazing. Valet found our football team's game on the car radio when we had to leave the hotel in the third quarter. Driving directions were always available. Downsides? Overpriced food with no other nearby options. Pool with slides, not overly warm water and the slides close at 4 p.m. (long before we got back to the hotel). The view is amazing and I liked not being in the middle of town. Would be nice if there was a shuttle of some sort available for sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lori_Ling
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed here awhile back in April 2008. We selected this hotel because of it's location to Sea World. We were able to walk from Sea World to our hotel. This is not located in downtown San Diego, it is on Mission Bay, you must be aware of the location so you're not disappointed later on if you want to be downtown. In the evening, we walked around Mission Bay and found a place to eat. It was quiet, peaceful and quite enjoyable. The hotel has a very nice pool and my son enjoyed the water slide. Our rooms actually opened up into an outdoor hallway, which we are not as accustomed to, but in California, with the nice weather, it worked out. We had no compliants and enjoyed our one night stay, afer a visit to Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “solid all around”
Reviews.Author: AriDicker
Reviews.Content: we booked it on priceline for a really good price. when we got there i just asked nicely for an upgrade bec we had a baby and so she can run around. they gave us a "corner room" that had 2 bathrooms, 2 fridges, a big living room and a conference room with a table off to the side. the bedroom was big and clean and had a nice view to overlook the pool. the internet was down on the entire floor so that gave the key to another room (my wife had already unpacked and didnt wanna move) so i could plug in my laptop and finish an assignment. i thought that was nice. also no fee for the babies pack-n-play. the only complaint i had, was that i was sore the from the rape/fee of $20 A NIGHT TO PARK. its not like you have a choice either. there is no overnight street parking nearby that i saw so you have to pay it. i just find that not to be nice when hotels do that

Reviews.Title: “Beach house feel, exceptional service culture”
Reviews.Author: BarneyO
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my brief stay here, and will organise next family US vacation to come back again. Service was outstanding. The rooms vary a lot as there are some old, apartment style buildings and a modern hotel buidling. I had an apartment and loved it. Yes, it is a little basic, but it has all the detail of a nice beach house. Wooden shutters, while walls, casual furnishings. It is very big though, with a large lounge, large bedroom looking over the marina and separate bathroom. All was very comfortable. The rooms come off an outdoors walkway which some may have a problem with, I did not mind at all. There was also a small individual balcony. All facilities where good. Breakfast was ala carte due to off season but was first rate. Pools etc look good but I did not try them. Marina is a very nice environment. I had a car and found the location very good as it was easy to get in and out of and a chance to warm up prior to hitting the mad freeways. 10 minutes to the zoo, same to the airport. Best was the service. After some bad experiences with a lack of flexibility and customer focus at other hotel chains, I was very pleasantly surprised when I had to change some arrangaments here. I was given assistance that saved me a lot of money, at a loss in revenue to the hotel. A big change to quoting policy we are used to from most. I am now committed to returning the favour and will be loyal to Hyatt as much as possible as a result. Price was very good, may have been off season special though. Overall, keep in mind this is a regular Hyatt experience, with pristine rooms and ulta chic furnishings. It has more of a holiday house feel, but very warm and the location on the marina puts you in instant holiday mode. I think this would be a great option with kids, given the size of the apratment as well.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be updated.”
Reviews.Author: multitrips
Reviews.Content: We were in the suites, which were comfortable but dated. The bathrooms in particular need new fittings and decent towels. In the winter the building was stark with howling winds ripping through the corridors but it is probably lovely in the summer. The location is great if you don't want to go anywhere - there is no shuttle into town and the taxi service locally was very expensive - we ended up hiring a car because it worked out cheaper. I stayed at the nearby Hilton years ago and thought it was better value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel--far/secluded from downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Bigger32
Reviews.Content: This is a striking hotel / resort. It has an "open-air" feel about it, especially in the reception area; and it certainly feels like a resort. The hotel is a series of smaller buildings surrounding a main "tower". The interconnecting grounds are absolutely beautiful. However, during the place in time I was a guest, it was unusually cold in San Diego, and I did not like having to go outside to go the restuarant, or lobby, etc. The hotel is in a marina setting, with beautiful views of Mission Bay. The rooms seem to be fairly recently upgraded (I believe this is an extremely old hotel, although faily well maintained). My room was nice enough--very attractive with a small balcony. Bathroom was very tight, but, serviceable. Regardless of what temperature I set the thermostat, the room never rose above 72. This may be fine and enjoyable for some, but, I was always cold, and in the 4 days I was there, I grew to resent this, and thus cannot say I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Since I travel quite a bit, I have come to appreciate buffets in the restaurant--so that I can fix my plate the way I want it. But, there was no buffet at this hotel, although the breakfast they served was totally acceptable. This hotel is in a fairly secluded area of San Diego. I think some people would really appreciate this. I do not. If I want to be secluded, I stay home in my bedroom. I first learned that I do not seclusion when I stayed at the Hyatt Miramar Resort in Puerto Rico. It didn't take long before I started feeling trapped and imprisoned!!! I am a vacation / traveller who likes city lights, and activity around me. The Mission Bay is not really my cup of tea, although it may be for others. There beautiful pools and cabannas; and palm trees--just not what I need in a home away from home. I would recommend this hotel for folks who enjoy getting away and being secluded. It seems to be a good option for this type of traveller, and especially if you still want to be within striking range of a major city and all it has to offer. But, if you would like to be able to walk to attractions, catch a cab to a restuarant, or walk to a club, or museum down the street--this place is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: Ben L
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of nights here with a large group. The reservations were made ahead and we received a great price for the location. The facilities are great with a pool and spa, great room views, a fire pit, work out facility, restraunt, bar, and cabanas to kick back in. We had reserved a room with 2 queens, and when we checked in (late in the evening) they gave us a suite with a king and hide-a-bed. That sounded like great deal until we pulled out the hide-a-bed, which had quite a bit of a slope and was difficult to sleep in. In addition, the carpet had visible dirt on it, there were stains on the couch and chair cushions, the latch on the bathroom door was broken, the bathroom door was off the rail, the bedside lamp did not work, and the cushions on the balcony chairs were missing. We reported the issues to the front desk that evening, and they offered to us another room. We were tired after an 8 hour drive so we did not want to move, and they assured us they would fix the issues the next day. The next day, they vacuumed the floor and fixed was the bathroom door; the other issues were not addressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Trip and Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rob C
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Hyatt. It had a nice family pool area and location. Close to the beaches and Old Town. They also have a boat shuttle to Sea World which made things easy. Nice rooms and very nice landscaping around the premises. The Tower provided awesome views of the marina and area--as well as the fireworks from Sea World. Only negative would be it was a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what you get!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGirl92201
Reviews.Content: The best rate we could get was $179 and then 25 more for parking! Then if you want internet it is another $14.00 per day! The room was missing the notebook outlining services and amenities and when I called to report it there was no offer made to bring another one. The room didn't warm up even after adjusting the thermostat and when the service tech came he discovered that the hot water heat vents inside the unit had been closed! There was loud music under our windows until well past midnight making it very difficult to get a good nights sleep. You would think that for that price there might be a shower cap in the bathroom, and more importantly a decent coffee maker. We had to hold the button down the entire time the coffee was brewing.. and then put it into the two paper cups! Really, not even a ceramic cup? The view was lovely, and the quality of bedding was excellent. We have been attending company parties there for years and our overnight was to be a treat, but it was a big disappointment. We have always parked for free on the street for these events, so the $25.00 extra for the parking was an unpleasant surprise because as we learned there is no street parking between 2AM and 4AM. When we checked out there were room charged on our bill that were not ours! You can see that this special event wasn't quite so special!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Shabbiness”
Reviews.Author: thenewval
Reviews.Content: My first impression when I walked into my corner waterfront view â€œsuiteâ€� in the tower â€“ wow, a large room with a great harbor view! But over the next two days, I became more and more disappointed due to the following: -Stained table in living room - large brown and pink stains all over the table. Aside from the stains, table had dirt, crumbs and hair on it; I asked the front desk to send someone up to wipe it down. Unfortunately the stains remained. Table edge is falling apart. -Hole in ottoman. -Food encrusted on one of the couch pillows. -Stained table top above mini fridge - appeared to be coffee stains. -Large scuff mark on the closet door. -Bedroom curtains had dark stains in two places. -Large crack in toilet tank lid. -Extremely stained soap dish. -Two long blond hairs on the shower wall. -Very dusty telephone in bedroom â€“ clearly hadnâ€™t been touched in awhile by housekeeping. All of these things turned a classy room into a shabby room. This hotel could be great if they would pay attention to these small details - the grounds and area are just beautiful. But currently, itâ€™s a disappointment. Upon checking out, when the desk clerk asked how my stay was, I was brutally honest and gave him a written list of all of the items above. He said he made a copy of it and gave it to the manager, but I find it very odd that a Platinum status member can hand over a page of complaints without the manager making a personal appearance. This hotelâ€™s only saving grace is their Regency Club staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for summer time”
Reviews.Author: Amandamluz
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has a big open are space and two big pools facing the Marina. It is a great hotel for summer time, but just keep that in mind if you are going in winter. It is a litlle bit far from the city center, since in San Diego you will depend a lot in Taxis and the fares are not at all cheap! In the hotel there is also an alternative for breakfast, a shop of the Einstein Bros bagels, where they serve one of the best bagels I have ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Blame it on the third party”
Reviews.Author: Runderful
Reviews.Content: I booked an Oceanfront Two Room Suite through a third party, confirmed my reservation with central Hyatt reservations and twice with the Guest Services personnel at the hotel. At check in they had me wait 10 minutes due to my reservation being a different night in their computer. They blamed the third party for the mix up and the option they gave me for a different room was not comparable. (made me feel like I was an idiot for booking through a third party as well and the manager wanted to get back to me in 10 minutes when I called because she was too busy working the phones-at a 420 bed fully commited hotel) We ended up with two rooms (standard) and after complaining about the service; free breakfast. If this is a four star property I would like to say that the service was not. Third party buyers BEWARE.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jessie222
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel and incredible view! I stayed in the Towers and enjoyed the balcony with a gorgeous view of the bay. My room was beautiful, however, the cleaning staff had to be called to re-clean my room, especially the drapes. Once that was done, the room was fine. The food at the Red Marlin was exceptionally good. The front desk staff and bell men were most polite and professional. I plan to stay there during my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “the wait for check in was forever”
Reviews.Author: quynhvy
Reviews.Content: we reserved 5 rooms for our family. It took from 2pm - 7pm to check in all the rooms, The receptionist was very courteous and professional only they don't have the room ready for us. Check in time was at 4pm. we arrived the hotel at 2pm hoping they would let us check in early. however each hour we got 1 room and the last room given to us was at 7pm. (They try to make up for that by charging us 3 car parking instead of 5) For the pool, it was very nice except it's too too too small for the hotel pululation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Hotel - L. Larry”
Reviews.Author: Birmingham_ALOmari
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed 7 nights at this hotel. Everyone was so very nice and accomondating. Special Kudos to Duane and Joseph who went above and beyond to make sure we had were satisfied. Never in our entire history in staying in hotels (we travel a lot) have we had anyone to be as helpful!!! The manager went above and beyond as well to make sure that we had a comfortable room and was satisfied because we switched rooms on the 2nd day because we wanted a king. It did not hold up our day - all we had to do was leave our luggage and everything was moved for us and we received a complimentary call to tell us that our room was ready. This hotel staff is to be commended for their interest in making sure that their customers are well satified. I can't say enough about Duane and Joseph (concierge). Baris was great @ checkout - so personable! Would definitely stay here again without hesitation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families.”
Reviews.Author: AZRoadqueen
Reviews.Content: Great location if you're in San Diego to visit sea world and other family-friendly attractions. My husband and I stayed here and not-so-great for a couple without kids. Our "ocean view" was more like a view of the pool which was packed with kids all day long. Great service which I love about Hyatts.

Reviews.Title: “clean and great view”
Reviews.Author: explore2
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with 2 small kids and I wanted a nice place to stay after staying at VRBO"s for the last few trips. We got an king suite and were in the suite building overlooking the marina. It worked out well as we had the kids on the one side of the room, that we could close off (when they went to bed early or were taking naps). There was a pull out couch in there and also lots of room for the crib. It was fun to hear the sea lions "singing" and pushing each other off the docks in the morning. The pool here is also great! There are 3 pools and 3 waterslides.We were in the water even though it was only 60'. The entire property is very clean and well maintained. It is centrally located in the city- easy to get to Coronodo, downtown, la jolla, and mission or pacific beach. We did have a car and I think you would need one for this location as it is isolated a little bit. The cons- You have to pay $20/ night to park. They must have worked something out with the city as you can't park out on the street from 2-4am. ( ugh!!) You have to pay for internet. -really in 2011? The are definitely out to make money out of everything they can. I also felt that the ft. desk staff were just there. We heard so many times through out our 5 days in San Diego how the economy had hurt the tourism in the city so bad, but I didn't feel that the staff were excited, thankful etc. that they had guests. When I asked about addition things we could get at the hotel- I got a blank look b/c I didn't book it directly through the hotel even though I did try, but got a much better deal on travelocity. They have no shuttle for sea world, the zoo, down town etc. They don't have any idea of how to advise guests to use public transport either.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up To Hyatt Standards”
Reviews.Author: Jeannemacl
Reviews.Content: We had visited this property years ago when it was the Islandia. All I can say is that they rally haven't done beyond cosmetic touches much to upgrad it. In order to get a room above the first floor in the "old" section we had to pay an additional $30 a night. Granted we were there with a conference, butthe differnce was a bit extravagant. The bathroom needs upgrading; the hand lotion "amenity" was half used; the bashroom door needed to be repaired before we could coose it, the tile in the shower needs re-grouting. The pool area is beautiful, and the conference food we had was very good, but the on-site signage is poor, the walk-ways confusing and very dary at night, and the staff appeared to be uncertain what to do for a medium sized group (200 people).

Reviews.Title: “Saved by its location”
Reviews.Author: LudwellMom
Reviews.Content: This property is beautifully located in Mission Bay but tattered at the edges. Our room was very clean and spacious, but the bathtub was cracked and peeling as was the wallpaper in several places. As we walked the property, we noticed the same sort of shabbiness in several places -- doors to conference rooms were seriously worn, hotel walls were marked up, etc. We ate at the Red Marlin Grill and were very pleased with our meal, but the prices are steep. In the mornings we opted for Einsteins Bagels -- a nice alternative along the boardwalk. We stayed several nights and enjoyed ourselves, but I do not think this property is up to the usual Hyatt standard. Perhaps our most disappointing experience was that, upon arrival late at night and with heavy luggage, we were completely ignored by the doorman. He simply did not acknowledge us let alone offer to assist (although we were the only guests arriving at the time). Again, not what we expect from Hyatt. The rest of the staff, and the concierge in particular, were extremely responsive and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark6299
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because that's where our seminar was held. I found that Hyatt web site gave the best room rates. I started checking daily for the preceeding 2 weeks and the prices dropped 4 days before I checked in. I saved $70 by doing this and it was a weekend! I was put into a room without a view, but because it was business, I could care less. I was interested in quiet and I found that. Room was clean and quiet with the signature bed linens which make you feel like you are sleeping on a cloud. Every staff person was pleasant and always said hello from the cleaning staff on up. I ordered in room dining for a dinner and a breakfast. The breakfast was abou 20 minutes late, but I received a call about 10 minutes after it should have arrived to let me know. The food was very good. The prices were moderate for room service. They tacked on 18% gratuity which is about standard these days [I have a beef about this practice, but can't do anything about it, and the hotel is doing nothing more than all other hotels].

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susana C
Reviews.Content: My husband, 3 year old daugther and I had an awesome vacation at this hotel. It is extremely clean, with beautiful view and excellent facilities. It is located in a nice area of San Diego, only about 10 minutes from downtown, and right next to Sea World. The staff was super nice and friendly. We were very impressed and satisfied with this hotel. Highly recommend it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: jws920
Reviews.Content: Overall great stay, beautiful property, good food, nice views, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disapporting with room”
Reviews.Author: Philip J
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel my wife and I stay in a very very long time. The room smelled. It was very small and look like a motel room we stay in back in the 70s. The room and where they put us was way below our expectations. Don,t be fool that this is 4 star as advertise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cgmeerfl
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel complex. Friendly staff. Great food. Marina suites are huge and when you sit on the balcony you're almost on the water. Location very accessible to all the attractions and the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: VacaGypsy
Reviews.Content: The hotel and amenities are nice. I feel like the pool, landscaping, marina make this place. The standard room was very average. No upgrades given out here.

Reviews.Title: “Second Bad Hyatt Experience In 12 Months!!!”
Reviews.Author: tokkihazel
Reviews.Content: Checked in on 17th September for a 5 night stay in a Bay Front Suite, check in was OK. Arrived at the suite which was WAY BELOW expectations: on entering the lounge/seating area looked like something from a down-market car rental reception and was dark smelly and scruffy, the sliding door to the bathrom was jammed half open and the "balcony" was so small there was no room to stand because the two tiny wooden chairs were using all the space and you could not sit on them as there was no space between them to put your legs! We phoned reception and after about an hour a maintenance man arrived who fixed the bathroom door so it could be opened and closed. The bathroom itself was tatty, dirty and had seen better days, as had the whole suite. We were extremely unhappy and went to Reception and told the Manager we would only be staying one night instead of the five we had booked. It used to be that Hyatt was an up-scale brand, you paid a premium and received a premium product. The Hyatt Mission Bay Resort is trying successfully to destroy Hyatt's brand and reputation - DO NOT STAY THERE. Our previous bad experience at the Hyatt Santa Barbara combined with this disaster at Mission Bay means that after years of being a Hyatt Gold Passport Elite Member I have transferred my points elsewhere and will not risk staying at Hyatt in the future - very sad.

Reviews.Title: “Liked This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaAudrey
Reviews.Content: In late June we stayed at the Hyatt with our four grandchildren and daughter and son-in-law. I really don't understand some of these bad reviews. I thought it was a lovely hotel, well-located to see a lot of the San Diego attractions popular with children as long as you have a car. We had two connecting rooms in the Tower overlooking the pool area which we really liked. The three connecting pools are great for kids. Another plus was the senior rate offered by the Hyatt chain. I do agree that the food was over-priced in the bar, Red Marlin restaurant and even the bagel place. Also, the only bar was right by the pool. It would have been nice to have more of an "indoor" bar in the lobby area and to have a more casual sit-down restaurant than the Red Marlin.

Reviews.Title: “So so...”
Reviews.Author: JobbinsHill
Reviews.Content: We had three nights here as the end to our four week adventure, and it was a tad disappointing. We had a Bay Room - enough said really. While it was tired and old, I could cope with that. What I couldnt cope with was the fact it was an adjoining room - and there is absolutley no sound proofing between the rooms. Noise, light, movement - you name it, it comes from one room to another. That might be fine if you are using both rooms, but when you are not it's unbearable. After two nights we requested a change and we shifted to another Bay room, this time a non-adjoining one. I wished I had asked for a tower room, but I didn't have time to muck around. The new room was definitely quieter. I left two items of clothing behind in the first room and they weren't found by housekeeping (to my knowledge)... I can highly recommend conceige services however. Joseph did wonderful things to help us with our tickets to Seaworld and Adrian did what he could to get us tickets to the football. That made for some happy kids in our group, so thank you again for your service. The kids liked the waterslides in the pool but they shut at 6pm, which after a day at Seaworld is a little too early. The Bagel place wasn't too bad for breakfast snacks - didn't try anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST hotel I have ever been in in”
Reviews.Author: Surfer1012
Reviews.Content: I have never been in such a bad hotel, everything was horrible. Our rooms stank and they blamed it on the sea air. The food was horrible in every restaurant, the only decent thing about the hotel was the quick ascess to Sea World and San Diego Zoo. Overall this is a let down compared to the other hyatt's I have been to.

Reviews.Title: “Corner Suite upgrade delivers spectacular view(s) of bay and ocean.”
Reviews.Author: Weinbob
Reviews.Content: Booked on priceline for $96 (thurs/fri/sat) and was offered an upgrade to corner suite for $25. Eighth floor, three views, balcony, seal or sea lion spotted daily , kayaks and boating sunshine spectacular views"experience" combined with 4 star sophisticated suite. Parking was $20 however it did not seem crowded and street parking seemed possible. Complicated but easy access to everything. Red Marlin restaurant pricy however great food and atmosphere. Good cheap fish and chips next door at marina. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ccinchico
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the warmth of October and found it very comfortable. We had a large suite that was on the first floor of the Suites building and in actuality it was too much room for us. We really never used the sitting room but it was so large that a family could have easily enjoyed the space. The room had nice views even if there was a small gate leading out to the boats right in front of us. This walk way did provide some traffic so we had to be careful to keep the curtains shut when walking around and dressing. For those looking for a beach hotel I would say this may have been a little out of the area but for family time like Sea World it was very conveient. With our case I do wish that there had of been more to "walk" to so this might not be my choice next time. We really enjoyed the little fire pit by the pool side bar and the various drinks that we partook in. It was quite relaxing outside during the Fall evening! Everyone that worked there was quite friendly as well. The pools and gardens were well maintained. We did not really get to enjoy them to swim in but they were beautiful in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “The bed was soaked in urine!!”
Reviews.Author: bob j
Reviews.Content: If I could give it less stars I would! So first let me tell you whatever picture they use on their website is not the room you get! This place is not the Hyatt you have come to known and they supposedly have done remodeling which we did not find. Our first night we tried to use a pullout bed from the couch...IT WAS SOAKED IN PEE! I dont know how the cleaning staff missed this but it was not taken care of and could obviously not be used. I then had to argue for a one night refund for this issue alone, not to mention mold in the bathroom, dirty room, and clearly no insulation between the hallway so you can hear everything! So the next morning the manager assured me all would be fixed, only to come back that evening and still have a bed soaked in urine and smelled clearly they did nothing!
