We enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Didn't' want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: PricelineNegotiator
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline about three weeks before we left and were a little nervous after reading reviews on this site! I have to say that my husband and I were pleasantly suprised and wished we could have extended our stay. The staff was extremely friendly - always smiling and asking how we were doing while passing by. The pool was nice - not crowded at all and only a few kids. I think the people that commented earlier about all of the kids need to realize that they were going during the middle of summer vacation - of course there are going to be kids at the pool!! The room was spacious. Since we booked throuh Priceline, we aren't supposed to be able to chose the type of room we got. When we arrived at the hotel we asked about a king sized bed in the tower, but they stated that they wouldn't have one available for an hour or so. After our horrible flight, we decided to go with a room in the tower with queen beds that was free at the moment. They said they would move us the following day but we decided the queen was perfectly fine and stayed there for the remainder of our trip. Although we didn't see the bungalow rooms, I would have to assume that the tower rooms are the ones to book. They have balconies that have nice seating if you have time to enoy that. We didn't eat at any of the restaraunts due to the reviews. but that wasn't an issue - there are a TON of places to eat around the hotel. This hotel is in a great location...just about ten minutes from downtown and the airport. Also, here is another tip if you are feeling risky - the hotel charges $18 for parking. We talked to one of the valet parking attendents and he said that although there is a sign on the street that says "No Parking" from about 2 a.m. - 4 a.m., he had never heard of anyone being ticketed. Well, we decided to try our luck. We stayed five nights and didn't have one problem. It seems a little ridiculour to pay for parking when it's not in the middle of downtown. Hope this review helps!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed!”
Reviews.Author: pasadenerbee
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to stay in a 3 star hotel as part of a time share deal for free! Thank god I didn't have to pay for it! it LOOKS pretty and fancy, but there were some problems which I would hate to have if I had to pay over $200 a nite. For example, self parking for $18 is really insane! And $10 a nite for internet is steep. It quickly adds up and for a young family(just hubby and me) it can turn a peaceful vacation/getaway to stress and frustration. We were bummed that there was no coffee maker. I wasn't feeling well and I wanted some tea, but we had no mircowave or coffee maker so tea was not a good idea. Also room service ends at 10 pm so I was just bummed out! I can get a coffee maker, fridge, mircowave, free parking, AND free internet at other places for pretty inexpensive (ala ramanda). The room and space looks nice, but my husband was frustrated because nothing is close by....the gym...any restaurants,etc. The gym is located way off to a far corner. Seriously, if I had to pay, I want to feel comfortable, relaxed....we felt really nickle and dimed. The mini fridge didnt work and they told us to leave the door open...what's the point of the cupboard? The lady when we called it in seemed annoyed with us. She told us that it doesnt relly keep things cold....and a fridge is for what pupose then? They sent a man to fix it and basically told us our fridge was too full(drinks- including MILK and some fruit), to keep the doors of the cupboard open and it's not suppose to keep things cold. WTH?! Also the bathroom and toletries were not what I told 3 stars was going to be like. It's small and not very pretty. I am pretty disappointed over all....there's many pluses, but I think if you're going to put that much money into a room...I expected more.

Reviews.Title: “some room for improvement...”
Reviews.Author: NoMercy346
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for 3 nights during our Summer vacation this year. When I booked this hotel I thought that I couldn't go wrong with this Hyatt property. The pictures on their website and the fact that it was recently remodeled looked convincing as well but after reading some of the reviews on here my expectations were rather low. good thing: I was not disappointed. When we arrived I asked for a tower room as those were getting better reviews than the motel-style ones. The room we were given was on the 2nd floor, though and they had no other rooms. The front desk offered us an upgrade for $40 a day to a room somewhere on the 10th or 12th floor. This was not the Regency Club Level either but basically the same room category we had reserved. What a ripoff, especially considering that we already payed well over $300 a night. We declined the offer and accepted the 2nd floor room. The room itself was very nice and had a friendly atmosphere with tastefully chosen colours and contemporary style. The furniture was all new and the carpet wasn't stained. The Bathroom was unusually roomy and opposed to earlier reviews our shower had a small tray placement area. The Beds - simply awesome! Smaller details leave a lot to be desired, though, particularly at this price. The balcony was covered in dirt and so was the furniture outside - maybe something they forgot about after the remodel? The hallway seems to be mostly untouched during the renovations as the doors have lots of scratch marks on them and although you get a HD-Flatscreen TV the video quality is average at best. I know these are nit-picks but this ain't no Motel6. The downside to a room on the second floor was that we missed out on the awesome view over Mission Bay but not the annoying noise from the children and the music at the pool well past 11pm. The pool area seems pretty cool with nicely kept garden surroundings but very crowded. Nearly all of the chairs were already taken by 9-10am and they ran out of towels by about midday. We didn't care because we barely used the pool anyway. The red marlin restaurant offers a delicious breakfast buffet that you shouldn't miss out on. We ate there every morning. Dinner is equally good but pricey (main dish well over $30). Overall we enjoyed our stay except for those little shortcomings. The hotel is a convenient starting point to explore the San Diego area. Sadly we couldn't enjoy the amenities of the hotel as much as we would have liked while still seeing so much of the city... The Beach is only a few minute-drive away and so is Downtown and Coronado. In spite of that I'm not sure if I'd choose the HR Mission Bay again. It's more expensive than the HR La Jolla which is getting better reviews and one could sometimes feel a lack of attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Let the Name 'Hyatt' Fool You”
Reviews.Author: TustinTraveler2008
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent Hyatt customer and, as such, have come to expect a certain level of quality at Hyatt hotels. This is my experience at the Hyatt Mission Bay - First, although I had specifically requested a room with a balcony or patio, I was given a room with NO balcony or patio. When I was then moved to a new room, our balcony was part of a large balcony that spanned the length of the building, with no dividers between rooms. The people next door to us were outside late at night and used "our" balcony, as well as their own for a small party they were having. When I asked to be moved to a room with a private balcony there were none available. In addition to the patio problem, our room (which was barely more than a standard motel room) had stains on the carpet and upholstered furniture, nicks in the wood furniture, and none of the standard amenities I would expect from a Hyatt (coffeemaker, toiletries, etc). There was almost no place to put our clothes (two tiny drawers and a very small closet with an ironing board that took up most of the space). My daughter and I decided to go to the pool, which was noisy and crowded. There were no pool towels available which wasn't a big problem as there was also no seating available. Once we finally got seats and towels (roughly half an hour wait), we ordered a drink. Half an hour later we hadn't received it and decided to leave the pool. We did not use the pool again because every time we went by we found it crowded, noisy, messy, and with an insufficient amount of furniture. There were a number of other minor problems and inconveniences, but my point is this - if I had gone to a Holiday Inn or Best Western I would have expected these problems - and paid FAR less than the $287 a night that I was paying. When I go to a Hyatt and agree to pay the prices that they charge, I expect more than the standard motel experience. Being a holiday weekend, I was not able to move to another hotel which, I assure you, I would have done if I could have found one. My husband and I travel frequently and generally stay at Westins, Hyatts, or Intercontinentals. This particular weekend was intended to be a fun "Mother-Daughter" getaway, with time to relax and rejuvenate. Our experience at the Hyatt Mission Bay fell far short of our expectations. Nothing about our experience merited the rates that this hotel charges!

Reviews.Title: “If you do not LOVE kids under four.... this place is NOT for you”
Reviews.Author: loralei33
Reviews.Content: Went to San Diego on the spur of the moment for a wedding. We live in Santa Barbara. My husband, my son and I stayed at the Hyatt just last weekend and I can only summarize it in this way: Here are the Pros: Hotel is conveniently located to area attractions The bed is extremely comfortable as those Hyatt beds are known to be. Room is spacious and is nicely appointed throughout INCLUDiNG the Deck. It seems all of the rooms in the tower have lovely viewsl. Ours looked out over the pool and the bay. The staff is acommodating and friendly. The grounds are lovely Ok and now for the cons: The hotel lobby is cold an austere with obnoxiously loud music that greeted us when we arrived at 11 PM, kind of strange for a Hyatt, I thought. The parking price is outrageous given, the non-urban environment, however, there are spaces on one side of the street, that are not marked that were avail to us so we DID NOT USE valet, which saved I think $24 /night, not sure of exact cost. The pool scene is an absolute zoo.... think Disneyland on a holiday weekend. We were there on a summer weekend. The pool and waterslide was filled and I mean FILLED with kids and their parents. As if your fear of public water needs to be heightened, I went down to the pool are at 8:30 AM one morning ( I will explain why I was down there so early shortly)and what was the first sight I saw?? Was it that of blue water, glimmering in the early morning San Dieg Sun? Well perhaps but I was also greeted by a three year old little girl who had stripped off her entire bathing suit and was squatting in the shallow end of the shallowest pool peeing, while her mother attended to her older brother. And now back to why I was there at 8:30 AM, we soon learned that the some of the guests send their children, as I observed from my deck , down to the pool as early as 8 to "reserve" chaise which only has a domino effect of mandating that eveyone do so if they wish to not be seated on the cement by the pool during the course of their stay. I complained to the concierge regarding the hotels policy of allowing this. She was sympathetic, and stated that " items left for 1 hour at the pool will be removed" .We did not see evidence of this. As for the food, we ate by the pool and it was as expected for that type of dining. I did not attend the spa, but honestly given the way the place is over run with kids, I cant say that I would have relaxed any by going there. As a side note, my 12 year old son had a GREAT time. So, there is an upside to all this. If you are a young family heading to San Diego, this may very well be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty. Poor Service.”
Reviews.Author: nyve
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the marina suite. Paid almost $400/night during high season. 5 night stay. We arrived late at night after traveling all day to a dirty room. Hair on the floor, a pair of dirty underwear beside the dresser, a dirty glass behind the chair, had to clean the toilet seat before we could use it, every table was stained and filthy. The next day after housekeeping came, it still did not improve. I tried to clean one of the tables with a wet washcloth and couldn't get it clean. I just laid towels over them. Balcony is extremely small. Visited the pool w/ husband and 2 year old on a cool afternoon. They promptly jumped in the pool after our lunch at SWIM (not worth it! - I had a salad, hubby and daughter each had a burger. Bill was almost $50. It came with a plastic fork & knife, napkin, salt and pepper in a packet. Burger was meat on a dry bun, mustard & ketchup in packets on the side. - you get the idea.) Anyway, I signed the bill and headed over to check out towels. They didn't have any and told me my best bet would be to get them from my room. I didn't want to make the hike back to the suite so I headed to the front desk. She looked at me as if I was staying at a 2 star hotel... Can't you just go back to your room? I can try to call and get you some but it will take some time. I said, "please call, I'll wait." I stood there for 15 minutes, all the while being ignored, then headed to find a housekeeper who gave me towels. I would have expected this type of service at LaQuinta or Residence Inn. We wished we would've saved the money and stayed there instead.

Reviews.Title: “They did a good job with the renovations”
Reviews.Author: goldbergd
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this hotel 10 years ago when it was the Islandia and was not impressed but since they had just renovated it we decided to try again. The renovation was great and completely changed the hotel. We stayed in the tower which I would recommend over the bay rooms. We had a great view of both the pool area and the bay beyond it. The rooms were very nice with flat screen TVs. The room was large enough to hold a king size bed, roll away for my son and still have a sitting area with a two piece sectional. The best part of this hotel is actually the water taxi to Sea World. They are the only hotel that offers this service and the boat drops you off in a private entrance in the back of sea world away from the crowded entrance and parking lots. If you are going to Sea World stay at the Hyatt for this extra service. The worst part of the hotel is the pool area. Not the new pool itself which is great but the lack of space to move around and have chairs. They built to large a pool for the space and now have no room to put alot of chairs. The fighting for the chairs that are there is horrible and gets quite nasty. SInce I didn't want to fight on my vacation we rented a cabana, problem solved right, nope, not by a long shot. Becuase there is no room to walk around everyone decided they should walk through our cabana. This gets old after the 100th person of the day walks through your stuff. Since this trip was mainly to go to sea world and not just lounge by the pool it did not disrupt my vacation all that much. All in all we will be back whenever we are going to sea world but might think about some place else if all you want to do is hang out by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Kids had fun on the water slides”
Reviews.Author: TABlovestravel
Reviews.Content: The room we had was very clean, I took my newphews and son for a mini vacation for my newphews birthday. The kids loved the water slides, but they should be open until dark. You have to get your chairs reserved by 7:30am or they are all gone. The pool ran out of towels at 9am and didn't get more for 2 hours. We had booked cholate covered strawberries to be delivered to our room at 9am as a surprise for the birthday boy. I emailed twice to confirm before we arrived, and checked with the concierge the night before, all set. Well 9am comes and goes, at 9:30 I went down to the desk, they had no answer as to why they weren't there, we were waiting in the room and wanted to get our day started! They said they would be right up, they finally arrived at 10:15. Rest of the trip OK, the lifeguard was really kind to the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Area”
Reviews.Author: BlueandOrange
Reviews.Content: The Hotel just went thru a $65 million dollar transformation to give it the Hyatt name. I can see what was upgraded or redone. It is nice but could have been done better. We stayed at the Bay II rooms overlooking the Bay. The rooms were nice and clean and comfortable, no real issues. To get the best from this hotel it would be better to be in the Tower rooms with the best views. The pool area was very nice, beautiful landscaping, great atmosphere. The water slides were not operating when we went which was a bummer for our kids. They are only open till 6pm which I think is nuts. The stay was good, though, down the road to Sea World where we went to. Remember if you want to take the water taxi to Sea World you have to have the Sea World tickets in hand before buying tickets for the water taxi. If you don't you cannot take the water taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Keep an eye on your credit card statement”
Reviews.Author: lmno240
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long weekend at the end of July with some friends. It was a little too family friendly (i.e. overrun with children) for my personal taste, but the room was nice and the spa was great. However, almost a month later, I looked at my credit card statement and saw that they charged me twice! The same charge, over $700, two times in a row. I called (twice, since they did not return my first message) and finally got someone on the phone who was a bit short with me. She finally did tell me they would credit the second charge back to my credit card, but it would take 5-10 days. I spent quite a bit of money here (spa services on top of the above mentioned $700+ for the room and food) and I'm feeling pretty scammed by this interest-free loan the Hyatt gave itself at my expense. I would like to think it wasn't intentional, but I don't plan on staying here again to find out.

Reviews.Title: “Almost ruined our trip”
Reviews.Author: megcorinne
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights in a Marina Suite for $369.00/night, two months before our trip. I called the day before our arrival to confirm that we were in fact booked for the Marina Suite and to give them notice that we would not be arriving until about 11:00 pm. I also confirmed that we were to have a rollaway bed. The person I spoke with told me that we were all set. We arrive at the hotel at 10:30 pm Friday night. Check it seems to go well, customer service is nice and the service is prompt. This is where things start downhill. We pre-pay $18.00/night for parking. We drive to the lot for our room and there is absolutely no parking left. So, we spend $18.00 to park in the street. I decided not to complain about this as the street parking was close to our room. Then, we try to find our room. Although I am accustomed to hotels putting even numbered rooms on one side of the hall, and odd on the other, this hotel puts even numbers on one side of the building and odd on the complete other side (through two gates that require your key). Also, there is no sign to tell you this until you walk around to the other side of the building. So, dragging suitcases and a cranky two year old, we eventually find our room. The patio area that greets us is filthy and has the prior tenantâ€™s room service tray and beer bottles on the table. Yuck. Then, upon entrance to the room, we realize that we are not in the Marina Suites (if I had been more awake, I would have realized this when there was no marina anywhere near the building). Instead, we are in a studio room with one king bed, and without a roll away for our (now really cranky) son. So, I called the front desk. They acted confused and then eventually told me that there had been a mistake and they did not have any Marina Suites left. After I complained some more, they told me they were willing to give me a $50.00 discount off the price of this room for the inconvenience. They also said that the next night we could move into the Marina Suite and if we left our luggage in our room, they would move it for us. Then, I addressed the issue of no rollaway bed for my son. I expressed the fact that he is two, it is late and he needs to go to bed very soon. They told me they would see about getting a bed. I also told them about the trash on the patio and they said they would pick it up. It took about an hour and four phone calls before we eventually got a bed. Also, they did not pick up the trash. The next morning we left to go have fun and came back mid-afternoon. I went to the lobby to collect the keys for our new room. The lobby was full of people checking in and there were about four attendants checking people in. I waited in a long line for about 20 minutes (it was obvious that the couple in front of me were having some issues that were taking a long time to solve). Finally, the attendant finished with the couple in front of me, and then she turned around and walked away without saying anything to me. I waited for about two minutes, as the other lines had grown even larger, and she did not return. The people behind me left for other lines. I went to the concierge and asked if there was anything she could do as I was a current guest, and she said no and that I had to wait in the long lines (again). At this point I was too mad to wait, went out to get my husband, and had him go back in and take care of it. We get to our new room (that looks absolutely nothing like the pictures online) and discovered that one of our suitcases had not made it to our new room. It took two phone calls before someone eventually located our bag and brought it to us. The living room of this suite was very small and very dark. Nothing like the picture online. Also, the bedroom did not have all of the windows that the pictures show. It had one sliding glass door and one very small window. Also, the balcony area was tiny; it was difficult to have even two adults on it. They did end up giving us the room for only $199.00 to make up for the issues. The room service was great, wonderful food, very prompt, very nice staff. Also, when they forgot to bring a rollaway bed to our second room, Courtney the manager brought it to us herself. Very nice. Not worth the price. We ended up spending way too much of our vacation dealing with hotel issues rather than relaxing. This put quite a damper on the vacation and put all of us in a rather bad mood. Would not recommend and I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Positive and negative”
Reviews.Author: highfield65
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 10 night stay at this hotel. Overall we had a fantastic time in San Diego! We had two interconnecting rooms in hotel. King corner suite and Queen room. The rooms were a good size, the view was superb and the shower in the King room was very good. The carpets were VERY dirty and one even had a huge cut in it. This had been covered over with some footstools. The bath/shower in other room was pretty scratched and not very clean looking. The daily clean of the room was superficial at best - eg not replacing glasses with clean ones, not wiping down surfaces properly and not sweeping balcony of sand. The pool area was quite small, they constantly ran out of pool towels and people were reserving sun beds from 8am. On the last day we actually saw people placing large pebbles on the beds to reserve the space! The restaurants were very good and the staff very friendly. The best thing about the hotel has to be the location and the ability to take the water taxi over to sea world. Jet skis etc were all available on site so that was another plus point. Would I stay there again? Not so sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DisneyFan30
Reviews.Content: Our room had a patio with patio furniture outside, the view was lovely. The room was recently updated with modern furniture. The bathroom was on the small side. The matress and pillows were very comfortable, A+ . The lobby was very crowded and check- in was slow. We did not use the pool area, it did seem very loud & crowded with families. We ordered room service, it was tasty. The menu was somewhat limited in choices.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Would return again and again”
Reviews.Author: RubyCoquitlam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights July 27 to August 3 with our 16 year old son and had a great time. We arrived at 4:00pm to check into our Queen Ocean View Room, none were available so we were upgraded to a King Corner Suite on the 17th floor at no extra charge,which included the Regency Club (continental breakfast, afternoon snacks, appetizers and cocktails). The location of the hotel is perfect, close to public transit, taxi stand, within (15 minute) walking distance of Mission Beach. The hotel has a special rate for rental cars, and an arrangement to drop off your rental right at the hotel. There are miles of walking trails around Mission Bay. We found the food was top quality in both restaurants. The staff was unbelievably friendly, Every single staff member that we encountered greeed us with a smile and a friendly hello. We had a plugged shower drain, and the engineering department arrived at our door within 10 minutes of the call, and the houskeeping department were arrived shortly after to clean up. We didn't use the pools or water slides, as these are definately geared to families with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Agreat family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: nomayo4me
Reviews.Content: My husband flew to San Diego to visit Sea World and the Zoo. Flights are easy as the airport is close and clean. The Hotel is very family friendly and has a "tropical" feel. You can buy your tickets at the front desk and include a water taxi ticket and a boat will take you directly to Sea World. The kids love it! Alos, the hotel has a fun family pool with a water slide. The views are great, rooms are clean, and lots to do. If you book the 17th floor ythey will include the Regency Club which includes breakfast and snacks. A great family vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the $$ - Hyatt should be ashamed”
Reviews.Author: Lancerdude
Reviews.Content: Stayed in many Hyatts before with great results. This one doesn't stack up. If they offer you a Bay I or II room don't do it, we reserved a tower room with a balcony, but was given a Bay room instead. Small and nothing to write home about for over $300/night. Also, booked hotel because of water slides but closed for 2 days. Agree with others, not enough seating around pool and the staff is not Hyatt friendly. Been to San Diego before and stayed at nicer hotels for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelwithkids
Reviews.Content: Hated to pay for parking it was $19 a night and $25 for valet. Their was no free internet, wi-fi or to use the computers. We originally booked a two bed room and got a king, they gave us a rollaway but were disappointed. They couldn't accommodate us because they were sold out. Pool area was packed and towels were out for 3 hours we just had to run back upstairs and dry off. Even though we paid for parking it was hard to find a spot. Other than that room was nice and location was beautiful. BUT we would not stay here ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “I would think twice before coming again......”
Reviews.Author: mtmommy
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to book this hotel for our family vacation. We have 2 kids ages 7 and 4 and the 3 waterslides at this hotel was the SOLE reason for me booking. Unfortunately we were so disappointed when we arrived around 1pm and found there were no chairs ANYWHERE around the pool to put our towels on. The staff feels the pain too. I mentioned to the lifeguard the problem, and she said, "believe me you are NOT the first to bring up this problem." There is room to add more chairs, it baffles me why they don't add more. The staff was the saving grace at this hotel. ALL of them were so helpful, nice and great!! We originally had a room in the Bayside tower, so HORRIBLE. I am not exaggerating. We were right next to the elevator and heard it all night. There were only 2 drawers to put clothes into, the nightstand table and a very small closet. The next morning we kindly asked to be moved. They were very accomodating. The tower rooms are MUCH bigger and have more drawer and closet space. Plus all the rooms have an inside hallway. If you plan on staying here and your kids love to swim, you HAVE to stake out a lounge chair by 8am or they are all GONE! The hotel restaurant was good, but very spendy. I think the fish plate I got was 29$. Ask the hotel staff where to go locally for seafood, and it is much cheaper. I agree with many other reviews that this hotel doesn't seem to live up to the Hyatt standards that I have had at many of their other properties. I will definitely send Hyatt a letter letting them know of my disappointments.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLadyTraveller
Reviews.Content: Nice refurfished hotel, layout is a little strange (is it a timeshare?), good overall service, great spa services, excellent room service (early arrival w/ good food), no tub, poor water pressure, good maid service, thousands of screaming kids at pool accompanied by some unrefined parents, but mostly a really nice place that I'll look forward to re-visiting when school is in session and the place is quieter and filled with business travellers. A nice touch is the Sea World fireworks at 9:50pm daily.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyable vacation”
Reviews.Author: affinityPA
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 day stay at the Hyatt Regency Mission Bay. I'm glad I ignored the negative reviews here and went anyway. We had adjoining rooms in the Towers, ocean view and loved the accommodations. The beds were comfortable, the rooms had a beautiful view of the ocean, the bay and the lovely new pool area. The rooms were quiet; the only noise we heard a couple of evenings were the happy sounds of young children enjoying themselves in the pool. We had breakfast twice at the restaurant; lovely marina location, and enjoyed the food although a bit pricey. The buffet was nothing special; we ordered off the menu. Our two 18 year olds loved being within walking distance of Mission Beach and being able to enjoy the pool and workout room. The workout room is perched over the marina with a great view. The hotel is in a nice location but with the exception of Mission Beach, you will need to drive everywhere. The only problems we ran into was that the only adjoining rooms we could get had a king instead of the two queens we had reserved;' they were willing to move us to a lower level with two queen rooms but we decided to stay put and have the higher level rooms with the great view and get a rollaway. The carpets were stained which was surprising considering the hotel was recently renovated; otherwise, though the room was impeccably clean. I think the key to happiness at this place is avoiding the lower levels and making your reservations in the Tower, not the Bayside I or Bayside II rooms or the Marina rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Say No To This One!!!”
Reviews.Author: mkjmom13
Reviews.Content: Wow - what a disappointment this place was. My husband and I, along with our 3 children, had a 4 day trip planned for quite some time and we were all really looking forward to it. We've stayed at Hyatts before, always with good experiences. When we go to Kauai we always stay at the Hyatt there and it's beautiful. And after hearing that this property in San Diego had undergone a major renovation, we were really excited. We were expecting a beautiful, clean room and everything we've always experienced in other Hyatts. We stayed in Room 2221 which is a suite facing the marina. The carpet was so filthy we literally would not walk on it in barefeet. And not just in one spot, I'm talking throughout the entire room. Large dark spots from the door through the entire room, a bright orange spot next to the bed. It was really awful. The sliding glass door on the balcony did not lock, no matter how hard we tried. Fortunately our children are old enough that this wasn't a hazard however it would definitely be for anyone with small kids. The shower drained so slowly that we called down to have it cleaned out. After our first night we called down to the desk to ask them to clean our carpets while we were gone and to address the shower drain and the non-locking sliding door. We returned to a room with carpet just as filthy as it was in the first place though they left a card telling us our request for service had been tended to. What? The pool area was nice to look at - clearly has been recently done and has an upscale feel to it. However, i agree with what other people say in that there is definitely not enough seating poolside to accommodate the guests at the hotel. We managed only to snag one chair to pile up our things on, but never could get a lounge chair. My husband and kids went in the jacuzzi and said it was not hot the way a jacuzzi is expected to be. It was just kind of warm. There was a sign in the room advertising the bottled water available for purchase but there was no bottle to be found. Our stay was supposed to be for 3 nights but after 2 I told my husband I wanted to leave. I'd rather have been at home than spend another night in this place. The only good thing is that it's located close to Sea World. What bothered me the most is that when my husband went to check out he told the manager in training all of what I have mentioned above. Of course the actual manager was "on the phone" and not available. A good business gesture would have been for her to offer to take some amount off of our bill or something else to show that the customer's opinion matters. I was not looking for her to comp our stay or anything. But she offered nothing and allowed him to check out having spent almost a thousand bucks on this dump. I went back in and took this up with this same girl since the manager was still "on the phone". I told her my concerns, how we have been patrons of other Hyatts many times, etc. She again had no intention of offering anything to us until I suggested that maybe they should take off the "room tax" they charged us for both nights and maybe take off the fee they charged us for using their Wifi service. She finally conceded and took off - woo hoo- a hundred bucks. How in good consicence were they charging 400 bucks a night for all this? I would find another place to stay for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay.....”
Reviews.Author: MWhitney
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. The pool and waterslide were so much fun for the kids & adults :) - they can not be beat! The lounge chairs by the pool are very comfortable and the SWIM bar has a great choice of food for both kids and adults at reasonable prices. They have staff to walk around and take your orders throughout the day, very quick service and worth every penny. The location is fantastic! Everything is 15 min away at the most. The breakfast buffet at the Red Marlin is great, get a great AAA deal and it's free but also so worth the price if you can't get it free. Great fresh fruit, cereals, pancakes etc. The atmosphere is really nice and the food presentation is great! They had plenty of choices for everyone. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, always offering ideas for activities on site. Parking is $18.00 but there is no resort fee so you pay one or the other if you go somewhere else. The rooms were very comfortable & clean, ask for a king corner room - it is a mini suite, very nice and perfect for a small family. They have refrigerators in all the rooms that are great for water & small snacks etc. Nice plasma T.V's, great showers and amenities. We loved it and will be back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable modern hotel - repeat patrons - GREAT service”
Reviews.Author: TexasPromQueen
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. We have stayed in the marina suites twice (other trip Aug. 07) and have thoroughly enjoyed it. We came in 07 despite rough reviews over the remodeling construction problems and were so glad we did. The nice modern design is perfect for a southern california vacation. It's a clean look with white bed linens, white bolster - comfortable w/ a front room sectional sofa & flat screen tv and then the back bedroom with a desk, flat screen tv, arm chair, and balcony with view of marina - boats literally right out your door. We could hear sea lions but it didn't disturb our sleep. This visit we were supposed to stay in the main hotel in a great room on a higher floor. However our preference is for a lower floor and were given the option to switch to the marina suites ( I think they only go up to 3 floors.) The front desk assured me the original room was better with a great view of the ocean but happy to meet our preferences. Another service plus, during our Aug. 07 trip, we lost the baby's boppy pillow that was a must have for the flight back. A bellman had found it and stored it for us. As well I had a problem with my rental car/parking etc. and realized it while sitting in the restaurant. The staff was incredible & called hotel security for me and helped me while I waited for my lunch. They went out of their way to help me! I ordered a simple burger& fries and it was so good. Great ice tea (I am a native Texan!), great service, and great view - you can see mission bay in the round restaurant with all windows. Like the hotel, the restaurant has a simple modern elegance that is very nice but comfortable as well. Very impressed! While my husband checked in, I steped out the back door to see the renovations completed that we're underway during our last visit. There is a courtyard of cabana like lounging areas etc - it's especially impressive at night with great landscape lighting. The pool looked smaller but nice and I didn't go into the area myself , just looked through the iron fence. The hotel is the perfect blend of elegance and comfort esp. since we've traveled with an infant each time. It is down the street from the Mission Bay board walk and amusement park and the bellman told me there is a trail/path/sidewalk I could stroll the baby from the hotel to mission bay. The afternoon I went to Mission Bay boardwalk, the beach was beautiful blue - a perfect day at the beach. Though we're used to Dallas traffic and commuting, this hotel is close to the airport and not too far a drive to all the places we want to visit. We never have trouble with traffic. As my husband comes to San Diego for business often, we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Too many kids!!!”
Reviews.Author: StBartsBabe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to get away to celebrate our anniversary. We chose the Hyatt Islandia since this was where we spent our honeymoon, 25 years ago. This hotel had just gone through a 65 million dollar renovation and it showed. Upscaled modern decor, lush tropical landscaping, everything was perfect for a romantic weekend. Our room, high up in the tower, had a large balcony which opened up to a fantastic ocean view. At 7 am we were rudely woken up by the scream of children playing in the 3 pools below. Later that afternoon we wanted to go for a swim and relax poolside; impossible. After dodging running children and navigating around strollers we could not find an empty chair or lounge. The 'adult' pool was full of tiny tots in diapers and the jacuzzi had the same. At one time we counted over 50 children in the pool area! This is NOT a place to go for romance and relaxation. A fine property for a family vacation

Reviews.Title: “Nice Spot”
Reviews.Author: hopkinspat
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a quick business trip and was very happy. Seemed to be a mix of business travelers and families. Not too far from the airport, and extremely close to the water. The grounds around the hotel are well cared for and pleasant. Great pool with a slide the kids will enjoy. Staff was very responsive and offered good suggestions for sites & restaurants in my free time.

Reviews.Title: “Advice from a local”
Reviews.Author: tonyk
Reviews.Content: We're local San Diegans that wanted to do an "in-town" vacation. We stayed at the Hyatt for one night. We booked on pricleine hoping to get the Hyatt and we did - great price. Having two young boys, 8 and 5, we were attracted to the redone pools and slides. The kids had a great time. They loved the slides and the younger one loved the walk-in pool with the shallow depths - it's great for the the little ones building their swimming confidence. The pool area was windy when we were there. It was quite odd as you stepped away from the pool area and there was no wind. We learned subsequently (for those into science or engineering) that it was known as the "Venturi Effect" - the tower of the hotel creates somewhat of a wind tunnel - wasn't desirable and you may want to research this a little more. The whole hotel was recently re-done and looks pretty good. Yes, there are carpet stains. Pool lounge had good food. Einstein's service was awful - the Hyatt should disassociate themselves from them. Lots of boat rentals available just by walking down the marina sidewalk - don't feel pressured to book anything in advance. Self-parking was $18 - and there's no reason why it wasn't free. I wasn't charged a resort fee, so I assume they don't have one. They have a water-taxi with service only to Seaworld. There is no beach here - you have to drive. If you're looking for an alternative, consider Paradise Point - beautiful grounds and equally good location, but may be a bit pricier. Dana Inn was across the street and may be a bit less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A great time & Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: larocki
Reviews.Content: I bid on our room at priceline.com, put in 4 stars for $100 and got this hotel...Very nice for the price. the pool area was great for kids and the rooms were newly redecorated with plasma tv's and really modern design. great time and worth the $100!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt.”
Reviews.Author: kerryannika
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we stayed at a hotel near Sea World and we were gladly suprised. Check in was quick (although it is at 4pm)and we ended up getting a suite instead of a regular room. It had a separate "boardroom", living room and bedroom and 2 bathrooms. We had 3 flat screen tvs in the room. The bed was very comfortable and everything was very clean. I was a bit worried because we were on the pool side of the tower but with the doors closed on our balcony it was very quiet and you could barely hear the noise from down below. The pools (3) were great and they had very long hours (6am-11pm) as well as slides. It was mostly kids during the day and more adults at night. We ate at the Red Marlin for the breakfast buffet which was mediocre. Definitely go to the Einsteins bagels on the dock and get bagels and coffee for breakfast instead. We did have late night snacks at SWIM, their smaller poolside restaurant, which was much better. They also have a great water taxi to Sea World which drops you off and picks you up for only $5 per person. We got to go through a back entrance at Sea World so there was no waiting in line with the crowds at the main entrance. They also had a 24 hour gym overlooking the harbor. Overall, a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Kidsville in the Summer”
Reviews.Author: MarkoLA
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property with a $65m renovation completed 12/07. Decor is tasteful and sophisticated. It is convenient to most desired sites in San Diego, including beaches, Sea World, downtown and Old Town. Service is excellent, and the staff is friendly. The front desk granted our request for a view room for our wedding anniversary, and they upgraded us to a corner suite at no extra charge. The carpeting had several large stains, which may be why this suite was available, but we thought this wasn't a big problem. Now for the flip side: from June through August this place is completely overrun with kids. Kids in all the pools, the hot tub, in the hallways, in the elevators, in the pool bar, yelling, squealing, crying, whining, running and generally just being kids, from early morning until 10pm. If you are a parent with young children you may be immune to this, but if you want a place to relax in the summer, this is not it.. We kept our balcony doors closed during the day and at night just to have some quiet. There is no common area on the property where you can escape this, and as a result, we spent most of our time (and money) off property. Hotel staff advise this situation changes dramatically after Labor Day, when guests are typically business people or couples without children in tow, and the property's spa and relaxation areas are used once again.

Reviews.Title: “4 star? Really? I'm gonna say no on that.”
Reviews.Author: Yaqona
Reviews.Content: We actually paid for the suite as it was our only summer vacation this year. The carpet was stained badly throughout and you actually felt dirty if you walked barefoot on it. The a/c barely worked (we had to call for service). The switch for the shower/tub was stuck on shower so no baths for the kids. And, they seem to nickel and dime you for everything. On the upside the customer service was good and the room service food was better than I was used to. The location was nice and the harbor views were splendid. In the end, there is no way this was a 4 star hotel and my room should have been half of what I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the Towers for a Great View!”
Reviews.Author: Yourstruly-Wa
Reviews.Content: Our one night stay was very nice. We booked through a blind booking on the internet for 4* and found that we'd purchased a night at the Hyatt. We investigated and saw it was about $100 per night less than the going rate, and also saw the mixed reviews. So we called and requested an Ocean view in the Towers and crossed our fingers. They came through with an 11th floor Tower room with a great view over the three pools, Mission Bay, and the Pacific Ocean . The room and bath were clean, nicely appointed and updated, and adequately spacious with seating on the balcony. Beds were a little on the firm side for our taste but not bad. Parking was was an add-on at $18 self park or $23 for valet. The restaurant was a bit pricey with coffee at $18/pot, so we took a short walk along the marina in front of the older "motel" room side of the Hyatt and found Einsteins, a coffee and bagel shop for a reasonably priced breakfast. The Hotel is across from The Dana where we stayed the next 2 nights, and close but a long walk to Sea World. Overall, a nice stay with helpful, professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern, and lots of Fun!”
Reviews.Author: motonica
Reviews.Content: After doing our research and looking at several hotels all around San Diego, we decided to stay at the Hyatt Regency Mission Bay. It truely was perfect! My husband and I loved it and so did our 13 month old son. Who we think had the best time of his life! From the moment we stepped into the lobby, we knew we'd arrived at a great hotel. We only stayed one night but wish we could have stayed longer. My parents and brother and fiance also stayed at the same hotel and they too thought it was great! The hotel staff was very helpfull, they upgrated two of our rooms to marina view and my parents got upgrated to a ocean view corner suite! The room was very clean! So clean that my son run around barefoot the whole time (and I'm a clean freak and would NEVER walk barefoot in a hotel room.) The decor was very modern... definitely NOT one of those rooms with the tacky floral bedcover. The pool was very nice, very kid friendly. Although we never got to try the waterslide, it was working the day we arrived but the second day it was closed due to repair?! There was a nice poolside cafe and bar... the menu was kind of limited though. We had breakfast at the restaurant and the food was YUMMY!!! They were showing a movie in the evening on the grass (with free popcorn) but we unfortunately couldn't attend because we had previous plans with family who live down in SD. They also had poolside activites for kids such as airbrush tattoos and balloon animals. So overal we'd totally recommend this hotel to friends and family. We can't wait to go back. Next time we'll for sure go to Sea World since it's so close and the hotel website said they have a water trolly that takes guests to Sea World. Great hotel, great service, great location, great trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: fave5
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms for five nights starting Memorial Day. Both rooms were overlooking the bay and ocean. One was a king bed, the other two queens. The room with the two queen beds had a shower with a tub. In our room we had our two sons and infant daughter (with a crib) and there was plenty of wiggle room. The view is beautiful! The pool was heated and the slides were open everyday that we were there. (very fun!) We were pleased with room service the one night we ordered it and the staff and housekeeping were very courteous and friendly. The hotel is very close to Sea World. There is also an Einstein Bagels at the hotel and a fish and chips restaurant next to the parking lot if you don't want to drive for a meal. Our rooms were very quiet and clean. You can take a water taxi to Sea World from the hotel. I was hesitant after reading all of the bad reviews and I am glad I chose to stay here anyway. My husband and I, our three children and my in-laws all had a wonderful stay at this hotel and we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “loved the hyatt Mission Bay”
Reviews.Author: LuvzTennis
Reviews.Content: I read alot of bad reviews on this hotel but we decided to try it based on a special rate after renovations. We stayed on the 17th floor Regency Club level. Everything was great. We had a beautiful room with a great water view.My only complaint was the carpet was stained which was surprising because the room was beautifully renovated. We were not on the side facing the marina so I can't comment on boat noise. It was very quiet during our stay.The Regency Club had great complimentary appetizers and breakfast every day. I would go back in a heartbeat but I do think they should clean the carpets. We were in room 1716 and really had a wonderful time. Staff helpful and all in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as it seems”
Reviews.Author: travelnomads
Reviews.Content: Frankly, I was a bit nervous about this hotel after reading its reviews. My husband and I needed a quick getaway after our wedding (our real honeymoon will come later), and this is the hotel our travel agent recommended. She accidentally booked us for a Queen double room, so we were a bit surprised when we checked in. My husband called down to the front desk, and the staff immediately moved us into one of their best rooms, a corner junior suite. We had views of the marina, swimming pools, bay, and ocean, and could not have asked for better views. We were also pleased with the location of the hotel, as we had quick and easy access to the places we wanted to visit. The room itself had a heavenly king bed (with lots of fabulous pillows), and sectional sofa, desk, table, ottomans, and 2 flat screen tvs. We did have a couple of problems...the toilet easily clogged and the thermostat did not seem to work (we were not prepared for the chilly/cloudy/windy/rainy weather). Both problems were quickly and easily taken care of by the staff when we reported them. Room service was timely and the food was good in the mornings, but in the afternoon, it took far longer to arrive and was not so tasty. Fair warning, though, apparently they use the same pitchers to serve coffee and hot water for tea. Every cup of tea I had tasted like coffee, so much that I ended up drinking less than half of it the two times I ordered it. We didn't try out the pools or the spa, but we had a blast watching people swim in 55-60 degree weather. I assume the pools are heated....They opened up the water slides only one day, and there were two lifeguards on duty. We loved watching little ones run up the stairs as quickly as possible to come down the slides over and over and over again. The staff were super-friendly and helpful, so no complaints there. Noise was not a problem for us, although I imagine that on a lower floor (we were on the sixth in the tower), that it could indeed be problematic. Overall, my husband and I agree that we had a great experience at this hotel. It was the perfect place for us to get away for some r and r.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice, loved it”
Reviews.Author: paulieuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a tower room which had bright, fresh and contemporary decor and furnishings. I fell in love with it when I opened the door! The centrepiece was a massive bed which was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. Also comfy and welcome was the sofa and footrests, the big flatscreen TV, and the comfy big cushioned chairs out on the balcony overlooking the marina. The bathroom was big, modern and clean, with a large walk-in and powerful shower big enough for two. Towels were the real deal, big and soft just like proper hotel towels should be! The room also had a big laptop sized safe, iron and board, and a radio-alarm with iPod dock, so you can listen to your own iPod in the room. My room had a connecting door, which did allow some noise to trickle through. They do charge $10 for 24hr internet access (cheap compared to Europe, but unnecessary) though I managed to find some intermittent access to nearby free network! The outdoor pool areas are great, though the whirlpool is very heavily chlorinated. We used the spa ($20 day pass) which is mainly the large steam room, with a nicely done relaxation room complete with fruit water, nuts, snacks and fruit.

Reviews.Title: “nothing out of the ordinary”
Reviews.Author: travelgalAvon
Reviews.Content: stayed two days on a business trip with the hubby. were upgraded to a huge suite overlooking the marina. carpets were badly stained, the room was incredibly noisy-you could hear every step of anyone outside, traffic and the charter boats going out at 6am as if you were out there yourself. just awful as i like to have some peace and quiet and there was none here. the pool looked nice but all water slides were out of order. restaurants/room service were good and prompt. the staff is very friendly but with the noise issue it's not worth going back

Reviews.Title: “Pay for internet in room? WEAK”
Reviews.Author: mrgreenman1
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review because I couldn't believe that in today's technological age, the Hyatt Regency in Mission Bay actually makes you pay $10 a day for internet service. I feel that price is a little steep for a service I can pick up at any local Starbucks. They seem to skimp on things like internet, but somehow find the funds to purchase such necessities as the iHome alarm clock which you can use wake up to your favorite tunes.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: mountaindewbebe
Reviews.Content: This hotel was horrible. We stayed here for 4 nights. The site was gray and boring and looked like it lacked a lot of personality. The only thing decent about this place was the pool & work out room. The pool had 3 slides which was really nice but the water slide pools were completely freezing. The other pool was heated which was nice. The rooms were horrible. They looked like they were decorated by a 3rd grader. The beds were nice and comfortable. The showers were a completely different story. We stayed in one of the 'suites' and the shower was peeling (the flooring was peeling!) The food was horrible, plain and gross and prepared by a 2nd grader. Ewwww.

Reviews.Title: “loud, filthy, horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: watspsyd
Reviews.Content: This was a horrific hotel. Newly renovated? Are you kidding? Smelly, dank, dirty, sticky carpeting, door lock broken, air conditioning didn't work well. We had to call the front desk SIX times to deal with loud, lewd and drunk people near our room. Security never came. We checked out at midnight and went to another hotel after being told there were no other rooms available. Thank god for Expedia, as they refunded the entire amount plus a bonus coupon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ralphs
Reviews.Content: We were attending a wedding and wanted early check in. Called the morning of check in and was told the room is ready anytime. This was special since the wedding was 3:00 in the afternoon and it was a very warm day. We were greeted by all the staff with smiles and welcomes. The setting is sightfully beautiful. The property is excellently cared for. Checkin was fast and uninvolved. Our room was quite spacious and very newish. A non-smoking room with out the cover odor. The king sized bed had a plethora of pillows and sufficient covers. Crisp sheets and a very comfortable bed. The TV was wide screen flat with a huge choice of viewing. There are many types of hook ups for iPods; cell phone and lap tops. An executive type desk with lamp and executive type chair are arranged by the large sliding door to the balcony. The view was into the city, which is some eight miles away, with the marina spread below full of yachts and sail boats. There is a full couch holding 4 extra sit around pillows; there are two night stands; two telephones and a dresser-desk. The night stands had two drawers each so there was plenty of space for two. The closet was away from the bedroom sitting room in a small alcove. Within the alcove was a cabinet with a safe and a refrigerator. Uniquely there was no coffee maker. However the floor above had a special room where there was coffee and snacks plus this was where the ample continental breakfast was held. This included four cold cereal choices with a variety of berries and nuts; fresh sliced fruit; yogurts; and an array of sweet rolls; toast; bagels and fruit juices. The bath had large soft towels; and the usual amenities. There was a scale also;personnaly I felt it over weighed a bit but my wife merely smiled. Our room did not have a tub; however the shower was huge with pulsating shower head. The balcony had twochairs and a low table.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined Anniversary!!!”
Reviews.Author: sogno_bei
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at the Hyatt due to the fact that they had finished their renovation and thought it would be great to enjoy the hotel in its new fresh decor. Unfortunately when i got to my room i didn't even get the room type i had requested and was told by the girl at the front desk i should have called and confirmed with the hotel that i was on my way. If i knew that I swear i would have never booked with a hotel that so absent-mindedly sold all their ocean view rooms and were banking on the fact that i would not mind the change in room types or view. Not only was my room view type overlooked but also was my bed request. I specifically requested a ocean view corner king for my 1st year anniversary. So after being told that even though i paid for that specific room type I was unfortunately not going to spend my anniversary in the room type i booked, but also i was not going to get a view at all. Actually what i got was a standard room with a view of a parking lot--absolutely what i wanted and paid for. Try explaining paying over $1000 for a weekend that was ruined from the start, to your husband! That was only the beginning. When we got to the room that we had not requested nor booked the room was suppose to have rose petals spread out over the room and also was suppose to have champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. And as you guessed it they weren't in the room at all. I paid an extra $45 dollars for this small added luxury that wasn't in my room nor would they bring it to my room after the whole ordeal. The room obviously was the beginning of the crappy weekend. Along with that the hotel has no amenities especially for the high prices you pay for rooms. You have to pay for internet services and parking services. The food was absolutely horrible. If you order room service the food won't be hot or warm by the time it gets to you. If you sit in the Lounge the waitresses are absolutely rude and brash. Or if you want to go eat a fine dining course in the Red Marlin forget about it. The food wasn't fine dining, nor was it up to scale. I found hair in my food and the waiter messed up our order 3 times. The front desk agents are rude and not willing to help fix any situations. When they tried to get a manager or when i called for a manager i was never able to get them. I had tons of issues with the hotel room such as the shower wouldn't drain and the toilet overflowed to the point it was leaking on the carpet it took 45 minuets for someone to get to the room to fix the problem. Also the Hotel operator lacked any care or speediness in getting the issue s taken care of. I was actually told by the operator that my situation wasn't dire so i could wait until someone was free. They also couldn't move my room due to the fact that they didn't have any more rooms to put us in. Sad to say this was all in the same day i checked in. Finally my husband and I were fed up with the lack of assistance and lack of a real hotel we decided to leave. That was until the desk agent told me that they refused to comp my nights stay because it was 6 o'clock and i would be charged a night's stay anyways. Between the two of us we decided to stay for just the night but we would check out in the morning and into another hotel that obviously is better with their guest and that doesn't have a hotel falling apart even though it claims to be all brand new. Trust me this is not a hotel to stay in if you want to be near activities or shopping. You need a car for all the places the guest services will recommend to you. the beach is about the only thing within walking distance. Also do not stay at this hotel if you want to have a ruined vacation or special occasion. The hotel could careless about you so don't give them a first or second look!!!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4-star!”
Reviews.Author: katyc
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the previous poster. The review is uncanny - I wonder if we were in the same room! For a recently renovated property, I was immediately put off that there was a strange smell (like old socks) in the entryway of the room, and stains on the carpet. The lighting in the room was poor, and our room had no in-room coffee. I almost had the feeling that there were spring breakers in March that trashed the rug and broke a lamp or 2 and the coffee maker! When we arrived it took 30 minutes for our bags to come up, and the concierge was less than friendly on two occasions. Yes the view was great, and my 5-yr-old loved the pools and waterslides, but that does not warrant 4 stars! I do have to say that the valet area had their act together - they were prompt, friendly and knowledgeable with directions. Lots of kinks to work out on all other fronts.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Disappointment! Definitely Not 4-star quality.”
Reviews.Author: jerseylil
Reviews.Content: What a huge disappointment! The grounds are beautifully landscaped but thatâ€™s it! The room was Not at all up to a 4-star hotel. Wasnâ€™t what we expected from the write-up and photos on the Hyatt website. It had the advertised flat-screen TV, plush bed and nice view, but Iâ€™ve seen the same in other hotels with better room features and better amenities. In fact, have had better at other Hyatts! Service was slow and poor. Rug in the room was stained. The small refrigerator barely worked at all and was set in a stained, rickety cabinet. Poor room layout; plenty of room for chairs and only one desk chair and one sitting chair in the room. Poor lighting, no overhead lights and not all the lamps worked. Shower was new but had no inside hand rail or ledge, and was slippery in spots with nothing to hold on to (only redeeming factor was nice showerhead). Windows opened but no screens to keep out bugs. Their website advertises coffeemaker, but what you get (and had to ask repeatedly for before it was even sent to the room) was a cheap, single serve unit with instant coffee and paper cups, not even real coffee mugs like youâ€™d expect from a supposed better hotel. Waited over an hour and a half to get extra towels, pillows and above-mentioned coffee set brought to our room, even though front desk said someone would be right up. In fact, all items were not even brought together, so the whole process took 3 trips from housekeeping. While we were there, we met another couple who had waited over an hour for a crib to be delivered to their room so their toddler could sleep. Not 4-star service! Evening front desk staff was disorganized and disinterested. When we checked in, we were kept waiting while one person trained another on the computer. Only compliment is for room service, dinner arrived timely and the food was good. Honestly, outside of the grounds and view, donâ€™t know why this Hyatt even has a 4-star rating! Should be downgraded to 3-stars OR they could actually put out some effort and make the room features, amenities and service 4-star quality. Wonâ€™t make the mistake of staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of Hyatt name -- outside is nice, but rooms are not”
Reviews.Author: AmishLou
Reviews.Content: Anyone staying here needs to know that there are two sections to this hotel. One is the "towers" with balconies overlooking the pool and/or the bay. The other section, where we were assigned (and probably most Priceline/Hotwire guests are) was the 70's motel-style sections, with outside entrances to the room. The cement floor outside our room was badly stained, as though people had gotten sick there. Our skepticism grew as we opened the door to our room to find filthy carpeting and bad mildew stains in the bathroom. I went back to the front desk to express my disappointment and asked for a room change. They said they were 100% booked and could not switch my room until the next day (it was after midnight when we arrived). Then the next day they apologized that there was no other rooms available either. Hard to believe...could it be because I was a Hotwire guest who paid $124/night? The room was bare bones -- not even an alarm clock!! Had to pay for internet. Upon complaining they gave me a free breakfast coupon for their restaurant and when we went there the next day found it was only for two. Had to pay for the children which made our total with tax & tip come to $40!! That was for a very mediocre-buffet. The grounds are nice but the beach is not easily accessible. Hotwire calls this "oceanfront" which it most definitely is not. The pool are was extremely crowded and the waterslides have limited hours. I have stayed in a lot of Best Westerns that are much nicer. Hyatt should remove their name from this property. By the way, it is the same hotel as the Hyatt Islandia. Even though their website claims it just underwent a huge remodeling project, the money was apparently only put into the pool and ground and probably new bedding...the carpets and bathrooms have obviously not been updated in a LONG time. I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone. Please note that someone staying in towers might have much better reviews so if you are assigned here please make sure you call to request towers!! BUT...the last night of our stay we were at the Hilton Torrey Pines, which was absolutely INCREDIBLE. Read my review on that for a completely different experience...that place is everything a resort should be!

Reviews.Title: “Not So Great”
Reviews.Author: PartyMartiniHouse
Reviews.Content: We were in downtown San Diego on business for two days and extended our trip through the weekend. We had stayed at the Marriott Marina Hotel Downtown, (an excellent choice), and knew a big convention was coming in to town so decided to move north to The Hyatt Regency Mission Bay. We were very disappointed in our choice of this Hyatt. We had read they had just finished a multi-million dollar remodel of the hotel and were looking forward to our stay. When we first drove up we could not figure out where the front of the hotel was. There is a tower which we thought would be where the lobby was located but instead, it was in a separate section which looked like an old motel. There were a couple of these motel-like buildings surrounding the tower. Knowing that we had gotten a cheaper rate which meant we would be in the motel rooms with no view, we elected to upgrade to a tower room. Upon arriving to the room which was on the 7th Floor I could hear screaming kids. I looked out of the sliding glass doors to see what was going on and found the view of the ocean which is what I had paid extra for was also the view of the pool which had at least 75 screaming kids in it having a good time sliding down water slides and swimming. The average kids age was about 6 and they were squealing with excitement running everywhere. We normally like to sit on our balcony, have a drink and enjoy the scenery, but that would not be happening in that room. Even with the doors closed you could still hear the noise coming from the pool. I called down to the desk and requested a change of rooms away from the "view" that we upgraded to and away from the pool. We were given a room on the 10th floor which had a view of the Marina and the freeways. We were glad to get away from the kid noise but now had the highway racetrack noise to enjoy. We couldn't believe the room had been remodeled. The only thing we could tell that had been changed was the addition of a flat screen TV, and the sink and shower in the bathroom had been changed. The walls had cheap wallpaper on them that had already been scuffed up by people's suitcases, the lounging area consisted of a cheap, modern looking L-shaped couch with no arm rests, the carpet was a thin cheap material which was already stained, the glass doors to the patio were filthy, the sheets had stains on them and we found long black hairs in the shower. The hotel advertises coffee makers but I had to call down to request one. The next day we were not given any additional coffee so had to call down and ask for more. Room Service prices were more expensive than the Marriott Downtown so we did not use it. We tried to get a spot at the pool but it was continually crowded with parents and their small children. When we did get a spot, we could not relax with all the noise. We thought if we got some drinks it would help make the noise more tolerable, but when we tried, we found out the bar/snack bar was not open. Seems they have special hours, and when they are open you have to go in an get everything yourself, no pool service. We ate our last night's dinner at the hotel's restaurant, The Red Marlin, and with their higher prices it kept most of the large families away. We had an enjoyable quiet meal with drinks, a shared appetizer, salads and a main course of tuna. The problem there was that the waitress brought out our main course before our salads. We then had to wait for the salads to be prepared and she assured us they would cook us new tuna. Don't know if they did or not. The moral of this experience is that this is a "family hotel" and we wished we had a way to know that before we booked. We didn't realize it was so close to Seaworld which is probably why it was full of families. Even without the kids I wouldn't stay here due to the low quality of the rooms. I guess with so many kids going through this place the "remodel" only lasted a week or so. If you don't like kid and freeway noise, even with the windows closed, don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great!!”
Reviews.Author: BenP
Reviews.Content: we just returned from a 2 day stay post a San Diego cruise and we were not impressed with a number of things. First the Pros the Staff was excellent from the lobby to the floors. It has a great view from the upper floors. The pool area is great but, it all stops there. It is really overpriced. You have to rent a car as the location is far from restaurants. They have a pool area bar that serves sandwiches and other bar food. There also is a semi-attached full service restaurant that is REALLY spendy, i.e. a 20 0z steak for $72.00. We had a car and went to the Dana which is accross the street and down the street and had a N.Y. for $20.00. The walls of the tower are thin as paper. We heard our neighbor talking in normal tones about everything. (I wont go there) The self closing doors slam at all hours of the night. There is no coffee machine forcing us to go to the pool bar for a overpriced cup. We had to leave early in the morning to catch an early flight and you couldn't buy a cup at that hour. I won't go on but we would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Updated and Upgraded !”
Reviews.Author: cjt1971
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel which has recently gone through some major renovations which have vastly improved not only the rooms, but also the service. Hospitality rooms offered happy hour munchies for free, but an honor system self-serve bar. 24-hour computers with internet access (a bit slow, but available), and daily paper. The new "chill-out" section outside the lobby replaced the old koi pond, but kids will love the expanded pool with slide and play areas. The poolside bar offered a late night menu with excellent ropa vieha (sp?) sandwiches and good drinks. However, this is the same Hyatt breakfast menu we had experienced in Kauai and the "eggs in a pot" and "sticky-bun french toast" cannot be beat. Have room service delivered now that they put the comfy contemporary chairs and table on the balcony. It's a great way to watch the kayakers/boaters/crews in the bay while you wake up. The rooms on the corners of the hotel are the best since the bedroom has it's own little alcove unlike the other rooms. Try to get one of these and you'll feel like it's truly a suite even though it's not separated by a wall. Excellent customer service sets this hotel apart and no matter if you're on the west side watching the ocean or on the east side watching the harbor and fireworks from Sea World Saturday nights, this hotel will exceed your expectations! We checked out the penthouse during a party, and it's amazing, but the kitchen does need updating. (no kitchen in most rooms)

Reviews.Title: “More pro than con”
Reviews.Author: SBHappy
Reviews.Content: The pros: GREAT location between downtown and La Jolla, making it easy to get to most attractions. - newly renovated - great pool area - nice spot surrounded by water and marina. The cons: the front desk staff is not at all friendly or welcoming - found long, black hair in multiple areas of the shower - pillowcase was dirty - stains on carpet. Overall, we would stay there again when we visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: tennisbummer
Reviews.Content: Was a little skeptical staying in this hotel, but the facility exceeded my expectations. Have bid on numerous 4-star hotels, and this one definitely fell into that category. Ask for a room in the tower (updated). The staff was attentive and courteous, the facilities were clean and well-groomed, the heated pools(with slides, and towels) were enjoyed by all. Parking is either free (right across the street in their lot) or you may have valet service. The room we stayed in was modern, with all the necessary amenities (shampoo, hair dryer, etc...even magnifying mirror). Did not eat at the restaurant. In summary, would highly recommended this hotel to anyone wanted to visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Such a Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: dwschwartz
Reviews.Content: March 31, 2008 I was really excited to find this hotel and my kids were wowed by the pictures of the pool area. Today, two days into my three day stay, i cannot wait to leave. The good: 1. Nice enough rooms. Clean and adequate to hold two adults and two kids, 8 and 11. 2. Friendly and attentive staff The bad: 1. The heater for the pool with the 100' water slide is broken. The water is probably 50-degrees. Some kids are braving the cold to go down the slide, but not spending any time in the water, because it's too darn cold. 2. One of the water slides is broken. 3. The hot tub is out of order. The water is green. 4. No in room wifi. 5. There are two restaurants, one is a bare bones and only sells bagels and danishes in the AM. The other is very fancy. Breakfast for 4 was $70. This hotel needs a middle of the road, family restaurant. 6. The hotel is situated in a way that there is a tremendous wind that whips through the pool area. It's been plenty sunny in San Diego today, but COLD by the pool because of the wind. Is it a surprise that we won't be back?

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Suites”
Reviews.Author: adamgator
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hyatt the weekend of the terrible fires ravaging San Diego County and other areas of Southern California. Weâ€™d already pricelined it and figured that our air quality in Los Angeles is bad enough, might as well go down to costal San Diego. WE called the Hotel to verify that the room was not needed for evacuees or emergency workers (weâ€™d have gladly donated it if needed), the hotel said they had plenty of rooms. Of course when we arrived, a major power outage in the Mission Bay area was ongoing (including Sea World). There was no way to pull up reservations, set keys, power elevators, etc. The office was trying there best. Pretty understandable given the major disaster covering the entire region. So we skipped freshening up and went into town for dinner. We called a couple hours later and they informed us that they had power. Unsolicited, they upgraded us to a fancy suite and gave us valet parking for the price of regular parking for our inconvenience. The suite was fantastic â€“ balcony over the marina, large bathroom, separate living area with convertible sofa and large flat screen TV â€“ we hooked up our travel DVD player and took advantage. Bed was extremely comfortable â€“ robes in room. Made for a nice relaxing evening and morning. The property was clean and well maintained. The exercise room was under refurbishing so they shuttled us (complimentary) to a fancy health club a few minutes away (no charge for its use). Mission Beach is a nice community and very scenic and relaxing. Pacific Beach across the river is nice at well, but a bit more sketchy. Close proximity to La Jolla for excellent sunsets. The only downside is the parking fee. Thereâ€™s PLENTY of street parking, but the city has made parking illegal for a few hours in the early, early morning, forcing one to pay 10-14 bucks for parking despite the availability of ample street parking. Itâ€™s one thing to do that in an urban area, but here it just seems to be for making $. Iâ€™ve stayed at the Dana Hotel across the street which does not charge (not as fancy as our suite at the Hyatt). Oh well, still a nice location. I cannot comment on the standard rooms in the tower section, but again, the suites were very nice. We used priceline and got a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!! Nice Renovation”
